reviewText:
Survarium won't survive

I started playing this game about 2 years ago (way before the steam release) and I loved the idea and concept behind it. I also trusted the developers and had faith in the project. But over the years I just realized that there is nothing to get here apart from empty promises.

Why is Survarium such a terrible project?

1. The development is extremly slowFrom the initial concept there is not much left. The developers keep focusing on just making money and adding more and more content people are willing to pay for, instead of actually developing what they promised. It had a generic PvP with some RPG elements when I started playing and until this point there is not much more to see in the game. Sure, it has a bit more content in form of items, maps and perks, but that's about it. The development is not much of a development.
The open world" was promised 2 years ago

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nOff of steam I've played this game for a good 300 hours. I was a decent player but not the best. Due to this game's whining community that meant I got accused of hacking constantly but never really thought much of it of course. Then on the 14th july they permabanned me for 'forbidden software' presumably because of repeated accusations. I've never cheated in this or any multiplayer game and frequently play with clan members all of whom have never cheated. We wouldnt even know how to. I have no forbidden ro even slightly suspect software. So it must be a mistake right? Try to contact an admin but they've banned me from their forum and website with no means of getting in touch. I've sent support tickets and emails and still recieved no reply. I've been a fan of these guys work for over a decade, yet they cant give me five damn minutes of their time to check im not cheating and give me back 100s of hours of gametime. Disgusting customer service. So long story short if you get this game and sink a few dozen hours in dont get too good. Cause the audience or devs might decide theyve had enough. Do NOT invest money in this game cause the devs can take it away with no explanation for a bull**** reason. You've been warned.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Alpha tester who flushed thousands of hours into the game... While the game is good and i have high respect and admiration toward the developers and what they have to go through i absolutely despise people in charge of the project and generally running the company.

Not only they are trying to milk a calf (Yes Calf not a grown up Cow) but also isolate and ignore the international community without events or promotions and a lot of sources of additional premium currency being available only for the RU side.

They automatically delete and ban posts and users who speak out against some of the choices made by the company the moment the criticism starts crushing them.

Also passing of information and raising questions regarding why one side of the community has these features/benefits and the others don't usually also end up with a disciplanry punishment.

In all the developers are great, the game is fun with good people, the community management sucks and people in charge of the company still run it as if it was 2003.

And i think a good note of warning be careful with their support...

I'm looking at you Bald-one and Joe...

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I seriously want to like this game. It has such massive potential.

Pros:

1) Sound is amazing. Play with a good headset and you will be able to hear every footstep and gunshot in beautiful deafening glory. Their sound guy deserves a raise.

2) Bullets hurt. No shrugging off 7.62 rounds like BBs. When you get hit you feel it. Head shot auto-kills, sniper rifles kill with torso shots, unless your carrying heavy armor.

3) Bleeding. When you get shot you tend to bleed, and left untended you will bleed out and die, so if you just winged a soldier as he ran in a building he might fall over dead in a few seconds. Bad part is you medkits to deal with it and they are one use and instant apply. Beginning you will not even know how to use it. When you do, it disappears and then next scratch and you're doomed. There are no ways to get more in game, until you die. Would like to see a medkit be infinity use but you have to hide and spend a several seconds bandaging and or tourniquet. They are so mandatory you will never get to equip any other items, like grenades.

4) Brings back tactics like sneaking and teamwork. At the moment no one works as a team, but if you get a group and do you can seriously dominate. Communication is god. Plenty of cover and concealment for the like minded sniper.

5) Leveling system is awesome idea and can help you specialize your play style, but still needs more work.

Cons:

1) Team Killing Rampant-There is currently no puishment for Team Killing and it happens alot. Nothing you can do about it. Vostek says to take a screen shot and then go to support page and submit evidence, except you can't. Page wont open, can't write a support ticket either, says I dont have permission.

2) Massive Unbalancing, this is one of the most unbalanced games I've ever played. SMG's do everything better than everything else. Get in a game 95% of players using one. Sniper Rifles have no scopes or anything terrible rechambering, slow you down, small mags, and server side glitched will mean you miss alot of shots due to everyone being Nightcrawler all over the map, so its like playing the game on hard mode.

3) Hit Registration is awful often disregarding single shots so sorry again, snipers you will often shoot right through your target while he blows you away with 30 well aimed non-scattering shots. Glitches a plenty fall through map, people teleporting, and invisible players.

4) No safe spawn point. The entire map is open for everyone so if you sneak around the lines, which is easy due to map size and cover, you can just sit in their spawn and kill them as they spawn. This one I can guarentee will happen in every game.

5) No prone. In Future Russia laying on the ground is prohibited, which really hurts snipers, causing you to stand still like a big dumb target.

6) Matchmaking is broken, only game mode you can get into is TDM and you will get matched with players from all tiers of play, so your first game will proabably be against god-tier players with heavy armor and LMG's and the worlds more accurate SMG's ever made. Using weapons that you can no longer attain due to changes in the game. So they will always have an edge over you.

7) In game store. This game has an In game store, which is perfectly fine for a F2P game, except that it is not finished and they say they can't even get small things like the damn Stars and Stripes" in the game (While they have like 30-40 others and their coat of arms

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Here's what the devs promised MORE THAN THREE YEARS AGO:

https://eu.survarium.com/eu-en/news/2013-game-development-timeline

Here's what we have now:

- game development progress has been incredibly slow
- we're still in version 0.42 with nothing but instanced PvP matches, where you can't even choose which map to play
- the devs decided to make their own engine for the game, instead of using a ready one - which means they spend a ton of time trying to get their engine to work properly, instead of working on new content for the game itself
- no server brower, there's only matchmaking
- no clan wars, no global map, no metagame, no MMO elements
- no Freeplay mode and there's no release date for it anymore
- no PvE co-op mode and no release date either, they haven't even developed AI yet
- the grind is ridiculous, there's 4 factions and you need to play for hundreds of hours just to max out one of them so you can buy the best armour and weapons for that one faction, but then there's 3 more
- subpar map design with plenty of spawnraping, you can easily get inside the enemy base and kill them a few seconds after they respawn, you are not penalised for this in any way
- no serious penalty for being AFK the whole round, so you could end up having several AFK players on your team for the entire round - which you will probably lose as a result
- if you get into a match which you don't like, you can't play another until that match is over - so if you exit the match, the game will keep loading you back in, until that match is finished
- poor optimisation and unstable servers: the game lags for many people, hit detection is a gamble and the game will sometimes resync and teleport you and your enemies around the map
- some obvious and seemingly simple-to-fix bugs remain unattended for months, affecting game balance and playability for everyone
- devs often add features which the community doesn't ask for and doesn't want, according to polls
- devs seemingly ignore most feedback and bug reports, to the point that some vets no longer bother to report the same old bugs or give any more feedback
- some weapons are simply overpowered and balance-breaking, but this is systematically ignored by the devs for many months - and they always leave at least one overpowered weapon in each new update!
- with update 0.42b they have added a P2W sniper rifle which is better than anything you can get for free
- there's a free public hack with ESP and aimbot included
- the game has no automated anti-cheat and the devs say it's not a priority. I'm not even joking!!!

To be fair, the game does have some positive traits:

- it's free
- plenty of different weapons and gear to choose from and customise - if you have the patience to grind for it, of course
- devs have already held several community events with some great prizes for everyone
- the gameplay is fast and easy, this is more of a twitch shooter than a simulator
- you can freely switch between regional servers without losing your progress
- the graphics are nice and the audio production is excellent
- the game looks a lot like S.T.A.L.K.E.R. and is developed by some of the same devs
- if you're really lucky, you can get some nice weapons and gear from loot drops after a match

Summary:

For every step forward, the devs take two steps back. They can fix one thing, but break another and add some feature which the community didn't ask for and doesn't want. They've promised a lot, but have so far failed to deliver even half of what they promised to deliver by this time. Most of the veterans have lost hope for this game and moved on a while ago. I feel sorry for the people who are still waiting for the devs to deliver some sort of miracle. That's the definition of insanity: doing the same thing over and over, while expecting different results.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This is to the Aussie's amongst us. The chosen few who piggy back on RU or NA servers because we don't have servers of our own. This is for the 250+ ping guys, or those poor saps with 300+. I salute you all.

I salute your perseverance in the face of getting shot through walls, and around corners. I salute your efforts at point blank range shots and melee, that missed 10 times out of 9, even though we swear black and blue we fired 10 shots. I join in your jovial laughter as you some how clip a guy from 1/2 across the map and he bleeds to death giving you your only kill that match. I stand side by side with you as you report that bloke who suddenly 180 headshots you literally every time you see him, even if he never sees you until he fires. I also stand by you, holding your shoulder as you cry, because the very next day he's still there, still playing, and still completely ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t. I salute your efforts at taking cover and being sneaky, only to have the server politely tell you that you're actually standing in the middle of a field, and yes, the bloke with the AK is killing you...which would have been helpful to know before you just suddenly go face down, your body full of more holes than a slice of swiss cheese.

My review is simply. This game has a lot of promise, not unlike that one seemingly unopened esky that should be full of beer on a hot Christmas arvo.

Unfortunately, this game is Aunt Martha's esky. It smells funny, contains nothing but goon and water and is the grave for at least 4 flies and a bee. Also, there's a bloke inside that has a shiny gun that he paid a crazy amount of money for and before you can ask anyone why the hell he's in the esky he shoots you in the face and warps off into the sunset leaving you half dead, confused and mildly infuriated.

Early Access Review

Massive potential but the devs are morons and make the game worse with every patch. Economy is ♥♥♥♥ed beyond belief, good luck making any amount of money past tier 6 if you dont get 15+ kills due to ammo and repair costs being so ♥♥♥♥ing rediculous. Rank 8-10 you end up losing money if god forbid you have a bad match.  Hackers are rampant at higher tiers and the devs will only ban if they get player recorded evidence of hacks through either a replay system that doesnt even function half ore recording it yourself and after that it all depends on if they want to actualy bother watching it. Heres an example of the devs genius: they put out a survey a few patches ago asking the community if they wanted kill cam. 70 ♥♥♥♥ing percent of the people that took the survey said no. Can you guess what the morons did? Added ♥♥♥♥ing kill cam which completly ruins any form of tactical play, flanking, being well hidden etc. RGO grenade spam is rampant so have fun with that at mid to high tiers. They seem hell bent on turning this into a generic f2p fps instead of what they promised. Theres a whole nother topic: Free Play. You know the mode all the STALKER fans give a ♥♥♥♥ about, ya they promised it would be out 2 years ago then said it would be out last christmas and here we are nearing the end of 2015 and they havent said a single thing in regards to the mode people actualy care about. Don't even bother trying to connect to an NA server unless you have the time and patience for 40 minute ques.


All that ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t aside when you actualy get a good game with people near your tier and both teams play well and smart instead of running around with smgs like its COD this game is great. WHEN I get a good game it becomes one of my favorite games. It is extremly atmospheric, all the maps are beautiful even after the the downgrading they have done and the audio is absolutley amazing and rivals most AAA games, when it doesnt bug out of course.

I can't say I recomend this in it's current state but that doesnt mean you shouldn't give it a try. At the very least keep an eye on it because there is still time for the devs to pull their heads out of their asses and turn it around.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nFor a free to play it's not bad, however the newer updates have changed it from a fun game into a grind based one. Unlike other reviews, this game isn't very pay to win - it's actually very well balanced in that respect. The community is mainly Russian and the developers are relatively unfriendly. Support is terrible unless you rant on the forums/social media. It's a fun game for a few matches but ultimately it falls short on many of the promises that were made to the community. There's no real team balance, there's cheaters on every corner (much like other games) but the response to them is poor and there still is no 'freeplay' exploration mode. If you're looking for a casual game then you might like this, but if you're looking to put real time into it, then this is not the game for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As you can see, I’ve have played quite a lot in Survarium. Even more than steam shows, as I’ve been playing it before it had been released on this platform, so u can easily add over 100 hours plus to my total.

Anyway. There’s quite a lot of things I do have to say about this game, but before I’ll go into things that motivate my final opinion - I’d like to state a few things loud and clear first.

There’s a lot of people claiming this game it’s ridden through with cheaters and haxers. It is both true and not. There are cheaters and haxers in this game, there’s no denial to that. But there also is a huge amount of veteran players that have high level characters, full orange gear with great mods and countless hours spent in this game just as I have. And believe me, there’s a huge number of them more skilled than I’m, and we all are just as paranoid about haxers and cheaters as many new players are. The problem is, we know this game through and through. We have tactics, gear and perks to make certain things work. We play (most of us I guess, btw that’s a tip for all the new players out there) on headphones and we’re sensitive to the certain sounds and that’s why we manage to turn around and shoot others in the head as they creep on us. We’ve been playing for long in our dwindling community where the skill cap was going only higher, thus we know how to play and how to play well. That’s the reality, thus not all the talk about haxers and cheaters you might see or read about it’s true. But it isn’t false either, as the .esp users are out there. And there’s even more of them now with the arrival of 0.40 than before. Which is obviously sad and upsetting even more now that the developers refuse to deliver us any kind of anti-cheat system and that cheaters are allowed to keep on playing the game with new accounts. Anyway, a lots of players you see and would want to call a haxer in the moment of rage - aren’t the ones. That’s how things are in survarium, as that’s the game where skill pays off way more than in other games.

Having this point out of the way, lets move on to what survarium is, and why I have such opinion on it.

Survarium is a great game in it’s own way. Even now, with dumbed down (or “cod’ed”) guns, the gunplay is still crisp and satisfying more often than not. And full of epic actions and bitter moments. The level u can customize your character is good, you can equip different pieces of armor and mix them all together to create your nicely looking avatar. You’re not tied to the levels and don’t have to use certain stuff to remain effective in the match, as long as you have the skills to make things work. The gear though, obviously can influence your performance, as it will offer you a greater protection or let you dish out more damage in a short time when it comes to the guns. In fact, if there’s something that defines your performance would be obviously your skill level and the gun you use, other than that - you can play the top tier matches just in a sweater without anything and still kick ♥♥♥ if you’re good enough. And with arrival of 0.40, you can further customize your character by customizing your weapons, not just the gear you wear and it’s looks. Making certain guns viable way beyond the tier they’ve been assigned to.

Other than that, that’s not the Stalker game. it does have some feel of it, but Survarium tries to be more or less independent of the Stalker and it’s legacy. In some way it’s a good thing, but it means not everyone will like it. Sadly if you’re here for the world module (freeplay), I’d say you’d rather forget it. I was waiting for it myself but seeing the progress of the game over the last year and so, I’m rather sceptic about will it ever gonna come to life in a playable form. Just nobody can tell will it ever gonna be delivered at this point.

But moving to the bad things, lets start listing those. I’m going to repeat the problem of cheaters and haxers here as it’s, as I’ve see it, one of the crucial problems of the game right now really. And sadly the developers do refuse to implement any kind of system that would be eliminating those on the spot, instead they let them play for a week or two, while these accounts will get reported numerous times, which will bring the spyglass on them and reveal the kind of cheats that are being used on these accounts. And finally ending in their ban, but the haxers aren’t locked out from the game completely sadly. They can make the new account, and do it again.

Furthermore, the netcode of this game... It’s one huge mess, and servers aren’t the best either. I’m not even talking about their problems coming from overcrowding them by the number of players that gave up on the title in wait for the patch 0.40 and are back playing again. I talk about that some (usually CIS server) players abuse the delays and pings no matter the server, making it impossible to play competitively as they won’t register hits, soak them like a sponge, and then just blast you off the face of the planet with ease. They’ll also cut u down on the corners as they’ll literally gonna be able to walk up to u and empty half of the mag before you’ll even see them.. It’s very annoying, especially when you play on your “local” cluster and yet they still have better delays and everything. Netcode of survarium is just bad outright awful when it acts up. And it does quite a lot of times sadly.

At last, the hugely awaited patch 0.40. It is a huge eye opener to me, as I find it rushed, unpolished and full of illogical stuff in. I was hyped about it, but upon laying my eyes on the changes, I’ve realized that the hype train for me it’s over. It’s poorly done, slaped up quickly just to get some interest back to the game - that’s how i see it. Don’t take me wrong, it isn’t outright bad awful neither it’s not that I do not enjoy it in general. But it is a huge mess, to say the least. There’s a lot of stuff I could start ranting about it. For example literally everything gets a silencer now. Thus in bigger perspective expect the SILENCOVARIUM not survarium. The players without those will be punished heavily for not having one, in fact they already are. Further, the lots of upgrades are outright awful, unlogical and all of them were pretty much slapped on everything. There should be a diversity, definite marker of roles for each class. Instead no matter what u have, just get it a silencer that’s all that matters. Going further, the upgrades itself. For example the scopes. People were waiting for cobra’s and different pso’s for the warsaw-pact weaponry. Instead they get nothing of it really. It’s even worse on some of the western guns, where x4 scope is being “played” by a high powered (with variable magnify) sniper scope. Yeah, that’s the model u get on your gun! It’s RIDICULOUS and that’s just one of very long list of things like that sadly…

There is a chance that with time things will improve. That the new renderer that’s promised will greatly increase the performance of this game. That developers will get their head around and fix some of the modules, and that they’ll add some new ones to replace or complete up the existing ones. But those are just hopes for me. I was waiting for quite a few things (including this patch) for over a year now, and VG never delivers neither never listen to their community. Hence why I give this game a thumbs down now. It have still some glimpse of a chance to become a great game, but I wouldn’t have my hopes up for that. Honest.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have put about 40hrs into this game so far and I am quite impressed! This game is not pay to win by anymeans. The weapons you unlock early on many higher level people use. Its seems most F2P games get a bad rap, this one is set up quite well. Paying for premium will get you to level faster, but you will play with people your level. so it balances out.

This review is subject to change.

Pros:

-Dripping with atmosphear
-Fast leveling (try to play research and collection. They provide the most experence)
-Cheap Premium (if that is your thing. By with gold, its cheaper and will go further)
-Vast array of weapons, ammo types, armor, and items to use.
-Fun fast paced gameplay
-Fantastic non-linear maps
-P2W element is non existant

Cons:
-Few gamemodes
-long wait times for gamemodes other than tdm
-Premium (purchased currancy)
-High system requirements
-Still have to wait for future content
-later levels can feel gindy

Notes:

I loved the STALKER series. So much I made the well known mod series SRAP for all three games.
With that I am probably a bit bias. I love the atmostphere that Vostok has created with this game so far. The last two years of development has gone into the engine and developing some of the earliest content. I have to say they have done a good job so far.
It seems now they are ramping things up. With the release on steam they are begining to add features and more maps to play on. As well as preparing us for the new gamemode known as Free Play". Basicly Free Play is going to be an openworld survival mode. It is predicted to be out later this year
recommended:
and will be free to play for all! So I am very excited for that.


Gameplay is... unique. Almost a blend of arma's movement

in turn level up a lot faster. I only put $15 into this game and I am level 30 and have unlocked tere 7.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

People don't understand this game.  People don't understand the devs.

This, this is one of the best arena FPS I've played in recent years.  And it's free, and fair, and the devs are generous and love the game.  Simply look at the game itself and what it has to offer.

Great attention to detail.  Consistently improving even minor aspects of the game.

Yes, the promised PvE mode is taking a bit.  But even in the current state it's a game worth your time.

People claim this game is P2W because you can buy powerful, high level guns in the shop with Gold(The paid currency)

Well, you can.  But, the way this game works with it's progression is through a rating based on your equipment.  So if you buy that equipment, you'll be matched with people that have similar equipment, and, unlike you, know how to use it.

People claim the devs are ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s.  I can't attest either way.  Perhaps they are, but their business practices say otherwise.  Maybe it's the language barrier.

Ultimately, it's a good game that people ♥♥♥♥ on because it's a f2p fps.  Understandable, but ignorant.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game seemed fun at start, which it actually was, but the more you play the more you notice all the problems of this game.

The first thing is that survarium needs so many fixes. Many bugs/glitches that users are asking to fix for over half a year, and they still don't. Instead they do a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ update with swappable face for your character (4 faces that look almost exactly like each other) and other crap like that.

There is a big lag issue because of the servers and the game's performances, which they tried to fix but failes somehow.

This game is partially pay to win: you have to pay in order to get the best gear / weapons, level up faster and get more silver to buy random stuff. If you play like me without premium it will take you probably more than 200 hours to reach level 10 fully in gear, and even more to max your skill level ingame.
You will also need gold (premium currency) to have 100% chance of upgrading your stuff (I wrote more on this below), you will need gold to change your character face or nickname, gold to find more staches after the game, and gold to have no waiting time when you repair your gear/weapons (waiting time is at least 6 hours, sometimes even 24 hours!). This is just stupid... Oh, did I mention  that when you have waiting time you cannot repair ANY gear/weapon for the next hours you need to wait?

The wait time to find a game is horrible. The fastest it goes to find a match is about 4 minutes. Sometimes you have to wait up to 20 minutes to find a match... Because of that you will almost always have out of 16 players (8 on each team) about 2-5 players afk for a part of the game or the whole game altogether.

They say they ban hackers and such but you will still be playing with many walhackers, aimbots, ect...

Weapon upgrade is also horrible. You need to spend silver that you win by having kills, but when you try to upgrade your weapon it says you have 50% of failure (which means you will spend your silver for nothing). But actually you have probably only a 80% of failure. I had weapons and gears that took me well over 10 tries to get 1/3 upgrades on it. That is 80K ingame silver! That's just insane...

The matches aren't fair at all. You will always play with higher ranked players, get lag from people that come to the wrong server, and occasionally you will get an ingame crash... In case you restart your game you will get back ingame, but killed by the ennemy. This happens 1/10 games.

They implemented killcams recently... But only 1 out of 10 times or more it displays correctly. Mostly you see yourself dead, or you see the beginning of the killcam and halfway through you just see your dead body.

Sometimes it even says something like 'waiting for server to load' and lags like HELL.

Devs need to fix this game ASAP, but they probaly will do some more ♥♥♥♥♥♥ update without fixing all the ingame bugs.

Conclusion:

This game doesn't offer anything new that other games don't have. Play this game if you have nothing else to do, but if you look for a good shooter, look elsewhere. This game sucks. Want proof? Look at the rating (currently 50% lol), the comments, or just plainly try and play for yourself. But know that you will end with lots of russian players who don't (want to) speak english.

After playing this for a few rounds, there's not much to experience at the moment, but I'm already impressed. There are tons of people saying this is P2W, but that is not the case. Conclusion:
So far this game feels like when I was playing Nosgoth. Amazing world and solid gameplay, but get repetitive and boring. However, while Nosgoth has to continue to follow that formula besides add more characters and maps, This game can expand into the PVE. As a shooter currently, they can only add more maps and guns and equipment and that gets boring fast. For now, I reccommend playing this is short bursts so you don't get burnt out. Also stop fighting sometimes and enjoy the scenery, they are gorgious.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I would like to say that I played a bit of this back in closed beta.
Not a lot, but it has given me an idea of how far this game has come, and hasn't come.

Inventory, Skills, and Customization

There are a lot of cash-shop elements, like shortcuts to better gear, rolling for the chance to upgrade gear (there are no mods, only stat boosts), additonal drops, instant repairs for gear, cosmetics, a premium account, skipping wait times for fiddling with equipment, the whole nine yards.  It feels like the early equipment is easy enough to get, and it doesn't seem like the bonuses are super-powerful.  But, it still doesn't feel like that helps balance things out.

There are far more guns, equipment, and items than there used to be, but I feel that a lot of those items aren't useful or interesting looking.  It is nice that you can somewhat customize certain armor items' appearance. Many are tied to the faction system, which mainly serves to slow down your unlocking of stuff.

Equipment is designed for protection from bullets, or for protection from anomalies.  However, armor value is lowered when the enemy is using low leveled guns, many weapons have high AP values, they all have AP ammo, and they generally have high DPS.  So, armor is a suggestion.

Isolation" armor protects you from anomalies
date: but those are in side areas/shortcuts

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Right, I'm going to try throwing a review out for this game, because I feel the others aren't quite doing it justice. I'll start out simple with the pros and cons, but before I start I'd like to state that while I do enjoy this game, I'm going to try to be as objective as possible.

Pros:
-Beautiful atmosphere and aesthetic
-Game runs decently well, although you will likely notice a significant fps drop when its raining
-The anomaly mechanic is pretty cool and allows for addition gameplay choices and styles
-Good diversity of maps with many ways to sneak and flank on most of them, though this is not true of all
-Devs are active in the community and are always willing to talk (in my experience)
-Lack of pay to win, as even premium weapons must be unlocked via leveling (though some still complain about it, I haven't noticed it as too much of an issue)
-Player level balancing is pretty good for the most part, though in the leagues this can change fast as you move higher
-Ability to customize your clothing with patches and materials, meaning the possibility of better camo with your favourite gear

Cons:
-Gun balance can be dubious in some areas, but nothing too serious for the most part (The Val is a particularly powerful gun, meaning that if you are stuck in a match with a higher tier player sporting one, then you're gunna have a very tough time)
-Game client and servers can be touchy, but in my experience the worst I've had was a simple bug that crashed my game when joining a match for the first time that day. Still I've heard reports of worse so keep that in mind.
-Leveling the factions can get grindy, and you can get stuck at a level where enemy players have better gear than you, but you have to fight them to get levels lest you downgrade your gear to get into lower tier matches

Now I would put more cons, but anything else I could think of is subjective or I lack sufficient information, so I'll continue down here. I'll also put points of comment down here as well.

There's a lack of team cohesion unless you bring friends, this is mitigated slightly by the quick commands the devs put into the game, but the main issue lies in the fact that there's very little reason to work together unless on one of the capture the batteries games. You can't heal teammates if you have medkits or similar items, you can't spot enemies, You're better off loading your guy with ammo and meds, hiding in a bush, and sniping the poor suckers till they find ya.

Now, this is a very subjective con, and many will likely disagree with me here, but I feel like this world lacks danger currently. I don't mean players, I mean the anomalies and environment. They significantly improved on the anomaly mechanic in patch 0.28, where they made them spawn around the map randomly, making the artifact hunter gameplay style much more viable. And while they do provide a huge boost to whoever has them, and do kill you if you lack isolation and stand around them too long without grabbing them or leaving, the devs make this world out to be a living hell almost. The anomalies aren't dangerous enough, they got rid of the fog on some maps that made rebreathers useful. The devs need to make the environment as willing to kill us as the guys on the other team, with acid rain that makes those with low isolation stay under roofs, plants that emit toxins, super storms that reduce visibilty and make it hard to hear.

All things considered, this game stands on a pinpoint. It has the potential of being a really good game, with the devs promising freeplay, mutants, and more. But there's a lot of problems that could use ironing ou first, stability, framerate drops, and gun/armour balance to name the most pressing ones. The devs seem to be pretty ok and in all honesty the game isn't bad, it's not quite a 7/10 either but I could probably place it at a 5 as it is at the moment average. Some say there's spawning issues with enemies showing up behind you, bullet lag and such. But I'm very sure they're exaggerating.

Like I said, I really hope this game comes through with the promises it has made and cleans itself up, but I tried to stay objective throughout. If I missed any points, I would recommend you to look at other reviews and read the forums, plus you could try the game yourself, I mean it is free after all. But I think I covered the meat and potatoes of this game.

As it stands, the game is a 5/10 for me. It's average, it has its bugs, and it has potential to become something great. I can recommend it to you, but if you do get the game keep in mind that it is EARLY ACCESS and my experience is not liekly to be the same as yours.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A game that promises to let you play in the deadly radiation, then shoves it into the back of the shelf in favor of a boring arena shooter.

Where's free roam mode?!

Edit: So it appears that the saltening is happening, and this little review is being baraged criticising this review and trying to defend a game. I'd be ok with that if you used factual evidence instead of shooting off on your emotions, so it looks like I'm going to have to go into further detail.

Firstly. Early Access is not an excuse to defend a game. The game is a product that is readily available on the steam store and one in which you can spend money in micro transactions. It shouldn't be given lenience just because it has an early access tag slapped on it. It should be judged based on the product it is now, which is what I've done. Maybe I'll come back to the game when it's finished and change this review based on the changes.

Now lets focus on the 2 main points I made in the review. Forgetting of course that the mentioning of free roam was a light hearted stab which people took way too seriously. Lets talk about the combat and anomalies.

The combat is horrible. Team Death Match and Control Points are so stale even the 2 headed birds won't go near it. The battery game modes are the games redeeming factor though. The way the game shifts from offence to defence while teams fight over the batteries is hugely interesting. It's the best thing about the game, defending your batteries from the enemy when you're winning then shifting to offence when they have more than you. It's a fun see saw and is the game's only redeeming factor.

The shooting is horrible. The hit detection is janky and suffers from the whole it takes 10 shots to kill an enemy but only 4 to get killed by the the same gun while wearing the same armor" syndrome. I don't know if it's just not registering properly or over compensating
date:
but the feeling of your guns being crap when everyone elses is great is just degrading. DESPITE BOTH PARTIES USING THE SAME WEAPON!

Also you can get killed in one shot by sniper rifles WITH HITS TO THE LEGS AND ARMS! Some might argue "You die from the shock! It's supposed to be realistic!" ♥♥♥♥♥ I have pants that regenerate my health! How the ♥♥♥♥ is that realistic!

Now it's time to look at the disparity between the factions. There's 4 in total. 2 are based around survival against anomalies
recommended: the other is built for combat. In a game where the anomalies are put to the side in favour of combat
hoursPlayed: which one do you think is going to profit more in an arena shooter? The one who'se equipment lets you survive the anomalies longer or the one who'se equipment turns you into a walking tank? I've played matches where my entire team was spawn camped by these hulking monstrosities
voteText: fueled by rage and fully upgraded equipment that ran on the maximum defence possible and our tears.\n\nIn case you missed it in the last paragraph. I mentioned Upgraded Equipment. The game allows you to upgrade the equipment you obtain in the game using scrap. Upgrading equipment gives it a random stat which is possible to change later on

reviewText:
ENGLISH REVIEW

[>[>[> I no longer recommend this game, but cannot paste this here nor can I change the rating to negative due to how Steam reviews work. Please check the comments section of this review for more info about this. <]<]<] Original review follows below:

Survarium is an ongoing project that is still officially in beta (albeit in the international open beta stage now), growing since the start of development in 2012. Recently, groups of scammers have appeared in the media who have insolently tried to use the renown of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. series to get some quick money by impersonating the old developers, but don’t worry – the studio behind Survarium (that is Vostok Games) is genuine. It is based in Kiev, Ukraine and it really was formed by some of the former employees of GSC Game World. Their aim is to create an online spiritual successor to the Stalker games, but one that has its own character and avoids the copyright infringement problems of that trilogy.

As for the game itself, it is a first-person shooter which currently has only one game type called “Teamplay” – though there is some variety in terms of objectives, as Teamplay is divided up into three separate modes: the first revolves around competing against an opposing team in capturing batteries and carrying them to your team’s base; in the second one you have to vie for control over strategic points on the battlefield; as well as the third and last mode, which is your typical team deathmatch. Teams are made up of eight people each, totalling up to sixteen players per match. The gunplay is slower and thus feels slightly more realistic than the average shooter, whilst the gorgeous maps of reasonable size make for engaging battles, during which the authentic firearm sounds go splendidly well with the immersive ambient soundtrack.

Generally, the game has evolved quite a bit through gradual little steps – it now has four distinct factions, personalised loadouts, clans and squads, side missions to complete during PvP matches, plenty of varied weapons and equipment to choose from, different ammunition types, decals and a choice of materials to customise your outfit with, artefacts to collect in-game that give you temporary bonuses, a rudimentary skill point system for your character, etc. It has also become a much more stable game than it used to be, with less glitches and crashes. However, the main feature that everyone is waiting for is the “Freeplay” game mode, which will bring larger open world maps that will provide an environment for session-based nonlinear survival gameplay (à la Stalker or DayZ).

At this moment in time, Survarium has few features on offer that would separate it from other F2P competitive shooters. It resembles S.T.A.L.K.E.R. aesthetically since it is post-apocalyptic fiction and most of the game’s maps have an Eastern Bloc feel to them, but the gameplay is less interesting and doesn’t have much in common with the beloved Slavic classics that we all know. Unfortunately, the creators at Vostok have stumbled a few times too by making numerous wrong decisions, such as dividing the game’s growing international community (along with all the clans and friendships formed within) into three regional servers or by almost continuously marginalising the non-European segments of their fanbase. Nevertheless, the game in its current state is at a decent level of quality, but with Freeplay due later this year along with the implementation of many other promised features to come… let’s just say that the best is yet to come.

--------------------------

POLSKA RECENZJA

[>[>[> Już nie rekomenduję tej gry, ale również nie mogę tego tutaj wlepić ani zmienić ocenę na negatywną ze względu na to, jak działają recenzje na Steam. W komentarzach tej recenzji znajdziecie więcej informacji na ten temat <]<]<] Pierwotna recenzja poniżej:

UWAGA: Mam mało godzin nabitych w tej grze, bo gram w nią od 2014 roku, czyli zanim została wydana wersja na platformie Steam.

Survarium to trwający projekt, który jest wciąż w becie (aczkolwiek już w etapie światowej „bety otwartej”), rosnący od rozpoczęcia przedsięwzięcia w 2012 roku. Niedawno w mediach pojawiły się grona oszustów, którzy bezczelnie próbowali użyć sławy S.T.A.L.K.E.R.a, aby szybko zarobić trochę pieniędzy poprzez podszywanie się pod znanych producentów, ale bez obaw – studio, które stoi za Survarium (tj. Vostok Games) jest szczere. Mieści się ono w Kijowie, na Ukrainie i naprawdę zostało założone przez część byłych pracowników z GSC Game World. Ich celem jest stworzenie gry sieciowej, która ma być duchowym spadkobiercą Stalkera, tworząc przy tym własną tożsamość, unikając problemy z naruszeniem praw autorskich tamtej trylogii.

Jeśli chodzi o samą grę, jest to FPS, który obecnie ma tylko jeden rodzaj gry o nazwie „Gra Zespołowa” – tym niemniej istnieje kilka odmian pod względem celów, gdyż Gra Zespołowa podzielona jest na trzy odrębne tryby: pierwszy polega na konkurowaniu z wrogą drużyną o to, kto zbierze najwięcej baterii i doniesie je do własnej bazy; w drugim walczymy o kontrolowanie punktów strategicznych na polu bitwy; oraz trzeci, który jest typowym „team deathmatch”. Poszczególne zespoły składają się z ośmiu ludzi, co w sumie wynosi szesnastu graczy na mecz. Sama rozgrywka toczy się wolniej, niż w przeciętnej strzelance, dzięki czemu wydaje się bardziej realistyczna, podczas gdy przepiękne mapy, zresztą o rozsądnym rozmiarze, pozwalają na zajmujące potyczki, w których autentyczne brzmienie broni palnej pasuje świetnie do wciągającej ambientowej ścieżki dźwiękowej.

Z upływem czasu gra zmieniła się znacznie, choć działo się to stopniowo. Ma ona teraz cztery frakcje, spersonalizowane „loadouty”, klany i brygady, poboczne zadania do wykonania podczas meczów PvP, mnóstwo rozmaitej broni i ekwipunku do wyboru, odmienne rodzaje amunicji, dostosowanie wyposażenia poprzez naszywki i wybór tkaniny, artefakty z tymczasowymi bonusami do zebrania podczas rozgrywki, rudymentarny układ punktów umiejętności dla postaci, itd. Gra stała się również dużo bardziej stabilna, niż niegdyś była; z mniejszą ilością „glitchów” i „crashów”. Jednak główna rzecz, na którą wszyscy czekają, to tzw. „Swobodna Gra”, która udostępnić ma nam większe mapy typu otwarty świat, gdzie toczyć się będzie prawdziwa walka o przetrwanie na podstawie nieliniowej rozgrywki (jak w Stalkerze albo DayZ).

W tej chwili Survarium nie posiada zbyt wielu cech, które odróżniłyby grę od innych konkurencyjnych strzelanek w rodzaju „free-to-play”. Estetyka przypomina tu gry z serii S.T.A.L.K.E.R., ponieważ uniwersum Survarium także przynależy do gatunku fantastyki postapokaliptycznej i większość z map w grze ma atmosferę powiązaną z blokiem wschodnim, lecz sama rozgrywka jest mniej interesująca i nie ma wiele wspólnego ze słowiańskimi klasykami, które wszyscy znamy i kochamy. Niestety sami twórcy z Vostok potknęli się już kilka razy, podejmując nieprawidłowe decyzje, chociażby dzieląc międzynarodową społeczność (łącznie ze wszystkim klanami i przyjaźniami, które w niej powstały) na trzy serwery regionalne, czy też wielokrotnie marginalizując swoich fanów spoza Europy. Niemniej jednak, produkt w obecnym kształcie jest na przyzwoitym poziomie, ale biorąc pod uwagę, że tryb „Swobodna Gra” jest przewidywany jeszcze w tym roku razem z wieloma innymi obiecanymi funkcjami… możemy powiedzieć, że to, co najlepsze jeszcze przed nami.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

From the creators of S.T.A.L.K.E.R, what could be a better reccomendation? Unfortunately the final result is not that great, Survarium as in version 0.30 is a rather disappointing F2P fps shooter, at least given the high expectations raised from the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. legacy.

Pros:
- Nicely drawn and detailed maps, one playing differently than the other.
- Anomalies provide a new feature compared to standard shooters.
- Realistic gun sounds and effects.
- Four different fractions to choose with different weapon / equipment settings.

Cons:
- Few maps, gameplay tends to get repetitive after some spending some hours
- Battles seem to be very unbalanced both in tier ratings and in player efficiencies.
- A lot of pay to gain advantage" elements

reviewText:
Early Access Review

---->Not a premium member<----
Im not one to ♥♥♥♥ away money on video games so Im often looking for f2p games like unturned and warframe and such.
For a free to play game it is very fun. Maps look amazing, mechanics are solid, gun play is rather nice, community is pretty solid too. But like every other game it has issues

Pros-
1-Beautiful map design. Maps are very though out, often multiple pathways to get from point A to B
2-Guns are rather comfy, have yet to run into anything clunky to aim and fire
3-has a pretty solid gear system, pros and cons to various types of armor, and EVERYTHING is upgradable
4-You are not stuck having to buy things both in game money or Irl money, you will often find items after matches like medkits,guns,clothes
5-Active community so match wait time is very low.
6-Not required to pay money to have any form of fun, game is 100% playable without spending a dime

Cons-
1-There are bought weapons, these weapons are usually stronger than base game weapons but fortunatly the bought guns are rather pointless and useless after level 6. you can get weapons just as good, if not better through earning them than through the irl money store.
2-It takes a higher end machine to really run this game well. yes you can fiddle with the setting and all but to really you still run a chance at fps drop and stuttery movement
3-there are a few cheaters but then again when isnt there in video games
4-from what I can tell updates are rather slow.
5-the penalty for leaving games or going afk is not strict enough (in my opinion) and so you will run into games where you might have 2-3 people afk.
6-the lower level youa are the more toxic the players are oddly enough. but it seems to die down a lot after a few levels as it matches you up against people within a level range.
7-earning money can be rather slow at times, so progression is not the greatest. BUT you have a good chance at finding usable gear/consumable after each game so  suppose that makes up for it.
8-there ARE adds after each map but then again its a f2p game. there is bound to be a few adds here and there slutting for premium or to buy games with irl money

All in all its a fun game, *shrug* its free to play so its not like i can ♥♥♥♥♥ about money spent

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I want to love Survarium, I've played so much of it and there's a wonderful concept full of promise here, but with freeplay mode constantly delayed, horrid lag, and worst of all, a truly massive number of hackers (mostly Russian/CIS it seems, by their trash-talk in chat being all cyrillic) abusing everything, I really can't. There are many enjoyable moments, but for every great match there's three or four terrible ones, mostly due to bad ping (only populated server is EU) and extreme hackers. The devs are extremely proactive and fair when it comes to publicly banning every offender reported, but the hacking problem is so out of control that there's not much they can do; they ban one hacker and ten spring up in their place, mainly because they've got no anti-cheat setup that'll stop the current aimbot/x-ray vision hacks that're popular now. I want to recommend Survarium so badly because of the upcoming freeplay mode which promises to be incredibly good, but the game is currently an extreme exercise in frustration due to the hackers, who will probably hack that mode badly too. Might give it a try again and change my tune if they fix these problems, but that won't be for a long time.

tl;dr: Hordes of hackers ruin everything.

10/10 devs, 2/10 hackers = 5/10 game. Sorry.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me start off by saying I was very much on the fence before finally convincing myself(after much huffing and procrastination) to download Survarium.

After having put more than a few hours into it, I'd say the game is worth a try. A test. Something to poke around with if you have a little extra time on your hands. Note, the game is still in -EARLY- development. There are bugs.. Its not the prettiest game out there..

But I must say, for the time Ive put into Survarium its been more than worth it! (And the game is free! Duh!)

The sound effects while in combat are phenomenal! Some of the best Ive heard in a long while, even from triple A titles. All the weapons feel like they have power behind them, and the environment(if you can dial up the graphics due to poor optimisation) truly fits how the developers envisioned the spiritual successor to the S.T.A.L.K.E.R trilogy to be!

Please remember, the game is still being worked on. Early Access. Pre-Alpha/Beta.. whatever you wish to lable it as. It -will- have its rough edges as most of these types of games do.

All in all, I'd give the game an 8/10. Would spend all night creeping around corners and popping heads again. (And plan to do so again soon!)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

BETA/EARLY ACCESS AND PVP ONLY REVIEW

I truly enjoy this game as a beta and can't wait for it to be released and with PVE. And here's why.

Pros
Sound; weapons are perfect. Every gun sounds meaty and and powerful.
Visuals; I firmly believe that the graphics engine is actually nice. The flora looks really defined and looks like what actual overgrowth would. The anomolies look beautiful, honestly have more of an alluring beauty than S.T.A.L.K.E.R.'s did. The weapons are sleek and look very nice. I wish they'd be a little more beat up and obviously worn out. The maps in this game are astonishingly perfect. I'd hug the designer of these maps if I could.
Gameplay; Guns are very easy to handle and just plain fun to use. Honestly one of the better FPS gameplay I've played in a while. The store is nice and straightforward. I really enjoy the lore and clothing items for each faction, I think it'll be really fun when the factions and players in the factions have a larger role, ie., roleplaying in PVE.
Anomolies/Artifacts; Anomolies are amazing, I love the differences and habitats each one has, some matches I would just sit there studying them.
Cons
Gunplay; Auto's, especially SMG's are too accurate. Plain and simple. It's broken and too accurate to be realistic. A PPSH shouldn't have the same amount of accuracy at full auto as a Remington 700.
Sound; Sound of footsteps need to be louder, sometimes the audio for it even cuts out. There's no audio for rain.
Anomolies/Artifacts; Anomolies aren't honestly intimidating enough, the blue gel at Chemical Factory honestly doesn't do anything but is a surface to walk on. Artifacts, and how their buffs work doesn't seem to be enough for me personally. They have a roughly 30 second cooldown, but they're active for five. I believe the buff should stay on until you die for PVP.
As for the P2W" everyone complains about
recommended: there's guns you can buy with gold
hoursPlayed: but all it does is give a Silver Rubles bonus
voteText: Rate of Fire bonus(Reload
helpfulPercent: recoil
votesHelpful: or aiming speed depending on the gun) and Reliability bonus. You can get as many kills with a Toz-34 as someone with the gold paid MR-27M Lancaster. The gold is honestly more used for decoration of your uniform if anything.\n\nTL:DR; I give this a solid 7/10. I can't wait for the full and most anticipated release."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I just want to say, this has the strong potential to be a very good game,  but releasing it on steam was the absolute WORST thing they could have done, early access is losing new games so many potential fans because of how broken they are.

Survarium is a game that you should keep updated every now and then, have a peek at the new features, then ignore it for a few months.

In terms of actual gameplay, there is a lot of really fun things to do, especially the RPG style weapons and armour use.   The MAJOR downside to this, is that due to the tiny population (hindered further by the botched steam launch) means that the matchmaking ends up putting you with people several tiers  higher than you (levels 1-10).  Where people can have up to 90% bullet damage resist, meaning your little starter weapons with only 10% armour pen and 25 damage ends of doing sweet F all to them.

But when you get a match against similarly skilled and geared players,  it's insanely fun! Especially on the objective based gametypes (domination style and a multi-neutral-flag CTF style).

I wouldn't suggest spending money on the game unless you have the cash to burn,  don't be suckered in with thinking you can just buy a high tier gun and play with the big boys becuse you'll get matchmade with them, but won't have the armour to survive.    I'd recomend getting the Warrior or Sniper packs, that gives you high tier armour as well as a high tier gun, the armour gives you extra faction XP and the gun gives you more $$$ in game.   Then with the remaining gold that you have, I'd seriously recommend getting as many faction reputation boosts as you can get, this way you can level up whatever faction you like, whenever you like, without having to worry about having a monthly premium" thing to worry about as each booster only works for 24 hours.    That way you don't have to play the game every day just to get value for your money.

Lastly

Early Access Review

When I downloaded this game I thought it was going to be one of those rubbish, bad quality, pay-to-win games like the others on the market, but when I actually played the game for the first time, I had a great experience, it is so much fun, and not what I presumed it was going to be, I've had a lot of fun on this game with friend, and I've only had it for about an hour.
My experience on this game so far is A*, no bugs, no glitches, just pure fun on it. I would associate this game with other games like Call Of Duty, Fallout and other FPS games, but obviously free-to-play, which makes it even better. The only con I can find about this game so far is that sometimes it might take a while to find a game, but that can be sorted out.

At this moment in time I'd rate this 8/10, very good and easy game to play.

reviewText: Having read a lot of negative reviews I went into playing Survarium with little expectation to its entertainment value. What I ended up with was quite a suprise for me and a couple friends who tried it with me. I am a big fan of FPS games and I have played a lot of them from original CS too current day Modern Warfare and BF4. Lately a lot of FPS games have bored the hell out of me and I have been shying away from them. This game brought me right back. I expected a lot of P2W and crashing but what I got was a well thought out 8v8 team death match. The way in which they set up the skill points/weapons/items/perks is the way it should be done. If you are thinking about trying this game please do. Do not get me wrong survarium has its issues as all games do but for a free FPS game this is the best set up for on that I have ever seen.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I know what you're thinking. You're thinking that from all of the positive reviews, that this game must be somewhat decent. Do not fall into this trap. On the surface, it seems like a fun free-to-play shooter, but don't be fooled. This game is garbage. I'm not just some salty noob. I've noticed things that cripple any potential this game has for being good. My biggest complaints are the clunkiness. This game (which is trying to be an arcade shooter of sorts) is as clunky as ARMA. This would be acceptable if the game was more tactical, but instead it ends up seeming like Call of Duty on meth. Aiming down sights in this game is a complete joke. When aiming, there's no smoothness. Slightly moving one's mouse doesn't adjust the sights to the target, it jumps pixels. This make long range engagements complete poo, because all iron sight weapons can't properly zero in on the target- they jump around it because of the poor integration of this mechanic. This makes long range fights impossible for those who can't dump money onto this low population, russian filled dumpster for a sniper rifle. There isn't any pay to win mechanic, but the fact that the weapons that can be bought on the paywall can only be obtained naturally through extremely boring grinding only serves to prove that the game is either looking for players to dump cash on it or leave. The community though, is the most hilarious part. Besides the rampant teamkillers and occasional hacker, the game has little to no population. 400 players is not only unacceptable, but hilarious considering this is an early access game. The majority of players that you will encounter are Russian, and hence you're in one of two positions- very laggy, or among extremely laggy people. This entire game is worthless and broken.

I give it a 5/10 only for one aspect, and that is the sound design. The gun sounds in this game are better than many other first person shooters, but this isn't enough to save the game. IMO, if the amount of time sunk into recording the weapons was spent on actually fixing this, the game would be playable.

Avoid at all costs. Play Insurgency or some of the better upcoming tactical shooters instead.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far this game is not recommended! Maybe later.
I do realise that it's not finished yet, that is why I am willing to wait for it to get fixed.

Pros:
*The skill tree and faction system is actually quite good
*A decent variety of maps
*Servers seem to be quite stable
*Not pay to win
*The progression system feels quite nice and rewarding

Cons:
*The gunplay and gameplay is sluggish and sometimes annoying as hell.
*The recoil feels like it needs a lot of work.
*Those colourful portals that create after a minute of playing and take away health don't make no sense to me. I watched and read all guides in the first 20 minutes but they were not mentioned, therefore they don't make ANY sense to me (why are they there, what the f... are they actually). They just disable crucial parts of the map and drain my health in a couple of seconds (it's stupid)!

I will check this game later, cause in some aspects it feels promising, but now - not recommended!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Considering first person shooters have been around in a modern form for the best part of 20 years, you would have thought the one thing a FPS should be able to achieve in 2015 is decent movement and mouse aiming.

Survarium is the exception to this.

Aiming up/down is slower than left or right, meaning that most shoot outs are hilarious encounters with others with poor aim. Apart from those who have paid for better weapons, which as predicted, you lose unless you pay the money.

Classic Pay to Win balls with a crap FPS engine - how a developer can release this as F2P and then have the cheek to actually charge for items and gold in the game when it frankly awful.

By paying money or playing this game you are just facilitating these crap releases and beta testing some awful work.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This Was The 0.27 Update Review! I Can No Longer Recommend This Game Because Most Of The Things I Listed Below Such As Hit Registry & Armor Penetration Have Been Messed Up After They Updated The Game To The 0.28 Update
Absolutely Stunning Free To Play Shooter 0.27 Update
Overview:Survarium is a post-apocalyptic free to play MMO FPS game. The game is primarily a first-person shooter, but also features several role-playing game elements.

#1 The Sound: A lot of attention & detail has went in to the audial end of this game, From the environment hearing the wind whistle in your ears to the blades of grass colliding with each other to the sounds of the foot steps when people walk to the weapons firing. You will be able to hear every footstep & gunshot every little detail in stunning beautiful deafening glory. The weapon sounds are especially great! they really pack a punch!

#2 The Atmosphere: Survariums post-apocalyptic atmosphere leaves absolutely nothing left to be desired, From its Abandoned cities & schools with over grown vegetation, To its Decaying waste lands, Ruined industrial sites & Its crumbling military bases, As mother nature begins to once again take over & rule with anomalies expanding across the planet with terrifying speed. There is so much beauty in this game. This game has a erie, creepy feel to it as well with its enemy AI in the form of mutants and environmental hazards such as anomalies.

#3 Game Play & Mechanics: The game is very solid it feels very realistic, From your player moving sluggish from having to much armor on or carrying heavy weaponry, To the penalty of not having enough armor on to protect you. The inventory system is very well thought out having to plan ahead for certain situations due to your player only being able to carry so much, Only having 2 profile customizations really makes you think on what items would be best for close quarters or long range, Am I going to be carrying to much weight etc. The games main system is so well thought out it really makes you think & mix & match things up trying to find that perfect combo of weapons & armor & items without feeling like a 500 pound gorilla walking around.

#4 Weapons & Damage: The weapons in this game are superb, From the way that they sound to the way they handle its very realistic & weapons really pack a huge punch!. The iron sights took me awhile to get used to but once I got the hang of it I was doing pretty decent. I can't stress this enough the guns in this game really pack a serious punch, Bullets really hurt if you get hit by a 7.62 bullet in the head you're dead period end of story you're done man you can't shrug off bullets like you can in other games. Like I said before with the bullets, But with armor it allows you to survive certain types of aommunition hits & this causes bleeding, You can bleed from any number of body part, Head, Chest, Legs, Arms & you have to bandage that up. The recoil on the guns is fantastic & as real as you can get, Example of this is the AK74M or AKM that thing kicks like crazy the recoil is extremely realistic but handles just great. Examples of me doing better with the iron sights see link here http://cloud-4.steamusercontent.com/ugc/539645482717945718/4FD2E3999B6C54F444CBF5734EC32EC47A420EEB/

#5 Hit Registry & Connection: My Personal average ping on this game is 110ms which in most games thats a bad ping, But in this game its actually a decent ping, There is hardly ever any lag that I can tell off all in all it runs really welkl connection wise. Hit registry isn't exactly perfect but its pretty spot on aim for the head & you hit the head, Aim for the chest you hit the chest etc. I have had maybe 10 games out of the 40+ hours & several hundred matches where I didn't get a hit marker & caused the other guy to bleed out. Hit registry is spot on!

With everything being said I might update this review later on & add more as new content becomes available! As the game stands now I give it a 9 out of 10!

5 OUT OF 10 AFTER THEY UPDATED FROM 0.27 TO 0.28!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My Survarium review Survarium is a free-to-play, currently early access game developed by ukrainian studio called Vostok Games.
It's current state is very debatable. By the time I'm writing this review, update 0.40b is out. It brings a new interface and UI. In this review, I'll try to cover a few game mechanics that you should keep in mind.

Shooting Hit detection is broken. Sometimes you hit the enemy and it won't register it. Sometimes a player will come back from the dead. It needs a bit of a work.

Pay-2-win? It maybe seems like it has pay2win mechanics, but you can get most of the things by simply playing, but it takes a lot of time. Personally i think it's not that much of a pay2win game but some players can have unfair advantage if they would decide to buy every paid item in the game. But as I said earlier, it's debatable.

Graphics It looks good. Not too good, but it's okay. It has really impressive lighting actually.

UI It used to look really mediocre, but now the whole interface has been transformed into flat minimalistic design. I really like it. It gives the game a whole new look.

Gameplay It only offers a few game modes:
Deathmatch
Capture the flag
Point capturing
The last standIt's not much but it's enough to keep someone playing. Devs promised something different though.

It has a lot of cheaters, but it can be rewarding. My recommendations. Give it a shot.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

It starts out frustrating up until Tier 2.
Once you unlock Tier 3 and get your hands on the SKS and SOK-94 the fun really starts. It's addicting, the guns are great, every damn day you're re-rolling your armor upgrades hoping for a better upgrade.
You'll fall in love with some guns, hate others, and abuse the broken once untill they get nerfed.
Music is fantastic, the audio overall is phenominal.

Guns sound powerful, not like peashooters, and the graphics and visuals are stunning for a F2P game. I recommend trying it and pushing through until tier 3, if you still hate it, then wait for another update, they change a lot of things fast, and most of the negative reviews are from the updates people didn't like.

It still gets updated frequently and changes drastically, this is a Beta done right. Nothing is pay-to-win either.

reviewText:
Writing this review with a couple houndred hours on account, with my name on top 100 in the old ranking system. http://en.svfan.ru/players/288437-aasen/profile.html

As a long time fan of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R. franchise, Survarium really caught my attention once Vostok Games announced they would make a PvE game back in 2012. The S.T.A.L.K.E.R. games have probably been a big inspiration to most of the PvE games out there. Keeping an eye out on their Facebook page, hoping to get a spot in the alpha-testing, I finally got the chance to play the game through a founder pack in January 2014.

Survarium will follow up with an eerie world with a post apocalyptic setting. The world is full of scavengers, traders and factions with different beliefs about living in their new world. Once PvE is released it will be a open world where you're free to scavenge and hunt, mutch like one could realize S.T.A.L.K.E.R. to be with a MMO setting.

Survarium is in its beta stage, and it's anticipated PvE is said to come later this year. For beta-testing there's currently PvP in forms of TDM, Base Capture (like flag capture in Battlefield 2), and 2 modes of collect the batteries"

During and after each match you gain experience points to level up. With each level comes one skill point that can be used in the skill tree. The skill tree helps your character become more suited for the higher equipment levels of gear

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Game caught me by surprise at how well it performs in its current state.
Very little bugs apart from the odd UI elements mainly in the menus. Some graphical glitches in game but they soon pass.
Graphically it isn't bad, but its no crysis. 60fps solid on High/Ultra w/ R9 290 so at least its optimised well enough.
Sound is pretty good especially the guns sounding like they have some real power behind them, but it can be pretty loud (even at low volume) and overwhelming at times but could be being used to near silence from playing CS:GO.
Currently is only PvP with TDM and Domination style game modes, but it's still fun.
Excited for the open-world PvE elements which provided they don't mess it up or suddenly give up for whatever reason, will be my main reason for playing this game. It has the potential to be a great survival game.
*EDIT* Matchmaking can be a pain when placed against higher level players (like any game) especially those using armour and full autos, when you only have starting weapons with low armour pen. Provided you're matched with players of similar rank it can be a lot of fun and much more balanced. This simply could be due to a small player base.

Do recommend this game even in this relatively early stage, and definitely recommend keeping an eye on the game for when new updates come out especially PvE.

reviewText:
Ok i haven't played the game too long but i can definitely tell you this game is NOT p2w like others are describing.
So if your a little skeptical of my claim keep reading. I'd like to adress and clear up the issue of p2w first as it seems to be of most intrest to people.

Reason why its not p2w:

-The game has factions, and to get armor you need to level up those factions. Ok so how does this make it not p2w you ask? lets go over the details.
+ First when you start out as level 1 and que for matchmaking, the game reads the level of your gear and puts you into the skill group to play with same level item people. So lets say your level 1 and rank 1 in your faction fresh after installing the game. If you spend lets say....30 dollars on a level 12 advanced faction weapon. You will be put against players in the level 10-12 range. Now to me, being in a match with rank 1 armor and a level 12 weapon is really tough! You may have the killing potential as all the other players, but someone with the same gun but better armor is going to kill you faster. The guns you can buy with real cash give you buffs like 10% silver gained per match or a measly 4% dispersion reduction. Not really enough to be p2w. I feel like the guns that you can buy with cash are designed to be used as an upgraded gun once you hit the level range of that gun. But the gun is by far no means p2w and anyone with a tiny bit more skill then you can easily kill you with the free version (which is not much different).


So overall about the gameplay i really do enjoy it.
The sounds are great and are the environments
it seems you get a more variety of maps towards the higher end levels
although i only just started this game and am unsure of how slow the developement actually is.

But from my thought, i recommend you at least try it, i mean its free and not that big
you'll find that this p2w" thing is not really as big as people are making it seem
and 1 shotting ppl with a mosin feels pretty dam good.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I joined the game when its version was somewhere around 0.20. While the TimeToKill was quite short and your situation misjudgement was very unforgiving, the game pace was more slow than fast and there was still room for team effort and tactical play.

Nowadays the game's been tuned to play more like brainless, skillless see-first-kill-first any eastern run&gun or CoD clone. TTK is nonexistent, so is teamplay and tactics. Twitch is all that matters... and lag. Infact, makers of Survarium like lag so much, that they literally build lag into the netcode. Nice! To make matters more fun, even tho each player should have the same amount of lag, which is around 200ms (what? Seriously, wtf?), some players will get strong lagshield protection, while others... well, they'll be carefully and accurately screwed. You'll be able to observe this peculiarity yourself, as Survarium has this really nice feature called killcam, with which you can see exactly who and how ended your life, and there you'll see very strange things that looked totally different from your point of view. For instance, you start shooting the badguy as soon as he pops up, but he kills you instantly. Yet on the killcam you see that he's been aiming at you for half a second and then stuffing you with lead for another half a second. Wonderful, isn't it?

Survarium is also one of the very few games in which a dead guy can still kill you, and I don't mean a grenade that dropped off his hand. You can pop the guy's back with a full mag and after that he can still turn around and kill you, yet on the killcam you see that you actually killed him while he was just turning around... so again, wtf mate? This feature is unofficially called 'tradekill' and I haven't seen this one since the dawn of multiplayer gaming.

There are actually some really good features in this game, no sarcasm. The sound is absolutely awesome, the graphics is nice, although it was better until devs started to tone it down so the game could run on a microwave, finally the level desing is also brilliant, save for some levels being heavily biased towards one team. However it's all for naught as the current state of the game makes the gameplay anti-fun and highly frustrating. There's massive lag, russian cheaters running all over the place, very strong Pay2Win stench and weapon mechanics that encourages the cheapest, ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥gy tricks there can be in an FPS, including the classics like WWI camping and spawnrape festival.

Stay clear unless you're a masochistic painlover or selfmutilation enthusiast.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Survarium is a post-apocalyptic shooter set in eastern Europe after an ecological catastrophe. In the aftermath of the calamity, groups of survivors have banded together to form groups known as Scavengers, The Fringe Settlers, The Black Market and The Renaissance Army. Each side can offer special missions to players which grant them further reputation with that faction.
As the name suggests, Survarium will have players choosing sides to fight for a chance at survival in this new hostile environment. Along the way, they’ll encounter anomalies and artifacts which grant special benefits based on the type of radiated matter its found in. Some abilities range from passive movement bonuses, to concealment from player scanners and even the ability to temporarily stop bullets.
While Survarium intends on offering an open world gameplay experience complete with the authentic lone wolf struggle to survive experience, the FPS in its current closed beta state only offers team-play which offers players a quick PvP option on smaller maps. Co-operative PvE missions are also planned, offering players to tackle objectives designed with two players in mind.
As players progress in the game they’ll acquire new gear while honing their survival skills in areas such as firearm training, medical skills, and the art of survival.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I AM A NON PREMIUM PLAYER
8,5/10
Pros
1.Fun
2.Different
3.semi realistic*
4.Classic modes with a bit of a twist
5.Beautiful maps
6.weapons are permanent when bought with in game currency
7.upgradeable weapons
8.Customization to your armour (stickers and materials)
9.Can find guns and gear without paying at all**
10.Some game modes needs team work
*Starting smg/auto rifle takes 2-4 shots to the torso to kill Bolt Action rifle needs 2-3 shots to the torso, Bleed effects, shot in the arm your aim starts to sway, shot in the leg and you don’t run as fast
** need to repair it but other then that it’s free

Cons
1.Shotguns OP ( too long range that they can fire and deal full dmg)
2.Cheaters (but what game doesn't have cheaters)
3.Ads after games asking you to buy premium***
4.Too many anomalies makes it hard to traverse the map
5.Can buy better weapons for real money (that doesn't really matter in the higher lvls 12 and up)
6.Abit clunky movement for my taste
***Turns up every 10-20 matches

Verdict
This game has real potential just do some tweaking the movement, button so you can disable the after game ads, a better anti cheat.
If i am not mistaken there is PVE in development as well (do not quote me on that)
Overall it is a really fun game and i highly recommend it because it is free and has more potential than most F2P titles i have played that are in beta.
