reviewText:
Early Access Review

People who claim this game is pay to win should actually look at the stats on the gear you can get with real currency before complaining. All of the gear you can get through using real money is worse than the gear you unlock through natural progression. Natural progression is a bit slow, but you can find free exp boosters at the end of each round through the scavenging system.

In terms of gameplay, it's a solid shooter with interesting mechanics such as limb damage that can affect your character's preformance. Weapons are lethal, and you will die very quickly if you're not careful. Armour camo actually works well, and helps you to blend in with your surroundings, offering a very real tactical advantage.

The only real issue I have with the game is that there are no anti spawn-camping measures. Thus, most TDM matches that you get in will quickly degenerate into a Which team can spawn camp the hardest" match."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

One of my favorite games.

I have well over 200+ games played pre-steam+ followed the games development since late 2013.

If you are looking for a post-apocalyptic shooter with NO ZOMBIES- then this is the game for you.

[THE GOOD]
-Maps feel big and open-ended. (There are also some small maps). Lots of little paths to take in each map, lots of little places to find and explore.

-Sounds and Visuals
I love the weather effects in this game, very atmospheric and really helps to engulf the player in the world of survarium. Turn up the sound and play with headphones :).
The game is very rough, but at the same time the sounds and visuals in the game are incredibly tight. Every step, each bullet fired sounds amazing. Smoke, fog and particles in this game look fantastic.

-Lots of guns to play with and each gun plays very unique. No gun is really the same, some are similar but each has its own feel. Earning a new weapon feels satisfying and rewarding.

-The shooting machanics are great: Things like bullet drop and velocity are real, for instance you do less damage per bullet depending on the distance of your target. Shooting through wood or thin walls are also a factor, and I love this about the game. Each round fired from your weapon feels responsive, and landing those hits is very rewarding.

-Unique post-apocalypse atmosphere. A very dark and gloomy future where plants have overgrown the earth...never heard that one before. I like it :) feels almost like stalker or metro 2033 in way.

-Looking for artifacts and using them is fun and feels differnent them most games.

[The Bad]
-Slow development. Still waiting on lots of features promised a long time ago.

-Slow match-making due to small community (hope steam helps with this)

-Slow grind for end-game gear can take weeks if not months to earn all weapons/gear.

-No free-play(open world game-mode) yet :( (Planned for this year, heres hopeing :))

-Not very well optimized for systems yet, pushes your graphics card and CPU to its limits even on low/medium settings. High system requirements, the listed requirments appear to low.

Overall this game is very enjoyable and I reccomend you try it!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Downloaded it for the nice gun models and animations.
Wasn't dissapointed.

The rest sucks, btw
- Bad hitreg (shoot first and die, shots not connecting to the players.)
- 75% of the players are teamkilling Russians
- Lag, mainly because of the bad ping.
- Almost all the servers are all located in Russia or the USA so you are going to have bad ping if you live in Europe.
- Horrible optimization. I might not have the best PC, but I got 30 FPS in the main menu and 20-25 in-game. (depends on how big the map is.) And that was all on the lowest settings possible.
- Premium guns and equipment. Its a F2P game, waddya expect anyway.

The anomalies seem kinda cool, but everything is poorly explained in the game so half of the time you don't know what to do, like how to stop the bleeding or how the anomalies can help you. This is very annoying for people who are new to Survarium/S.T.A.L.K.E.R in general.

The gamemodes are the standard run of the mill gamemodes, like TDM, Domination (called Research in this game).
I honestly expected something better, more creative ideas.

But you might think: this guy doesn't know ♥♥♥♥, he hasn't even played for 2 hours!
That is because it is unplayable for me at the moment.

Don't bother with this game. Its a shame to see such talent and effort wasted into such a failure.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Version 0.40c review

Currently, the game has gotten a whole lot better from v.32. The game has been optimized for lower end PCs, and the netlag is significantly less of an issue. The new interface is definitely an improvement over the old. The new weapon customization features are a welcome addition, as you can make your weapon perform to your needs. Certain weapons I feel to be unbalanced, either being too weak, or too strong. Weapon damages are inconsistent, as certain guns shoot the same round, but do very different damages (SOK94 does 50, AKM does 26/Mosin does 100, SVD does 65). These issues can be found in every game, and the developers do work on this. Overall, this game is definitely worth it for any shooter fan, and especially any STALKER fan.

Pros
- STALKER feel
- Heavy customization (gear and skills)
- Beautiful maps

Cons
- Occassional Netlag issues
- Balance issues (Some guns are weaker than they should be, some are blatantly too powerful)
- Takes awhile to find a match sometimes
- Occassional ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t (Cheaters, Spawnkillers, etc)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Before i even start. This is such a cool beta game. Not only does it combine the call of duty feel with a post apocalyptic world, but it is also similar to another game that i liked called Stalker. Even though this game is in beta, i find this game to be almost as addictive as crack. I have only had and played the game for 2 days and already have 25 hours on it. I also like the fact that the game looks freaking amazing, but yet my media pc can still run it on the high end pc setting. A couple of problems and my solutions to these problems (I will start with the minor problem and then work my way up). The first thing is that the scope menu is in the way of the actual scope. Once again, its a beta, so this will probably get fixed in the future. Now on to the things that bug me. First of all, i feel like they could add in the leaning feature, like whats in dayz, unturned and call of duty for example. Now dont get me wrong, this game is a complete master of immersion, with there being many buildings, cracks and crevices to hide in, but i feel like if the game developers were to add in this feature, it would make the game just that more awesome. My other problem is with the hackers. I know that the devs have fixed this problem and banned some 200 users in 2015, but for some reason they started to pop back up again. However, as i said about 3 times now, the game is a beta, so it will probably get fixed. My last problem is with the actual pairing up system for the games. It seemed like when i first started off in the game, i was getting matched up to level 4 scavengers and level 3 black markets. It just makes the game hard for all of the newcomers to try and get off of there feet in the first few games because they are constantly getting killed by these higher tiered players. In my mind, however, all of these cons are extremely outwieghed by the pros, which i have kind of already expressed earlier. All in all, is this game perfect; no, it could use some work. Would i recomend this game to someone; hell yes! And if i had to give this game a rating, i would honestly give this game 4.5/5 stars. So if you made it this far, thank you for reading my review that possibly has misspelling mistakes riddled through it. Lets hope the devs see our reviews and works on some of these problems. By the way, Devs, your doing a great job on this game so far. Keep it up guys.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI was incredibly excited about this game when I first heard about it's development back in 2013.  When the starter packs were available in 2014, just before the first external alpha, I bought one.  I played this game for at least 60 hours.  It was unfinished, but playable and fun.  I can't say that today.  This game has taken so many steps back from the initial alphas.  Yes, it's prettier than it was.  It's a little smoother, but that's it.  The gameplay, the weapons, the matchmaking system, have all taken huge steps back.  It's clunkier than ever which is very sad.  I can't recommend this game in it's current state.  A year ago, that was a different story.

reviewText:
Well for starts, try the game. It is vary good and well made and definatly can be the right game for you. Now on to more detail. This game is probably one of the most addictive fps, rpg, multiplay actions ive experianced in awhile. At the time of writting this review i have even taken notes on this game and done videos and have already posted one on youtube, check it out if you want to see how this game plays. struggles of rifles- Survarium

The enviorments are stunning, the graphics are unique and even help give the game a dark, desolight, grim wastland feel to your gaming experiance.

Guns, Practicaly give a you a relistic feel while your at picking off the enamy from 49 Meters away with a high caliber rifle, or creaping around a corner with your smg ready to unload into anyone who dares peak their head out. Almost life like on on that.

Armor, The armor and cloths in this game are set and created so well to make you feel like a mercenary higherd to take out as many punks the get in your way, wearing heavy leather and metal plates. Slow yes, can he take damage? ask the guy who caught a deer slug from him. He'll tell ya. Or a hunter who loots what ever he can find value in, moves with alot equipment yet is still silent and fast, unseen from a distance and fast when he is close. Also on top of it you can customize your armor and cloths to have different paints and decals of the faction for whom you have sided with.

Allegiance, You can choose your faction of your choosing, for the weapons, armor, and cloths (including paints and decals) as you climb up their ladder of ranks. you will earn the iteams that come with that rank. There are 4 factions at the moment. The scavengers, light weight troops who can carry alot and pick you off as quick as they can see you if your not careful, Their counter part, The black market. A group that uses heavy armor and big bullets you solve their problems. From there their is the next set of 2, The fringe settlers and The Army. The fringe settlers seem to be more reliant on dirty tactics, light armor, but hard hitting weapons, and the army seem to use heavy armor with rifles with nice distance and rate of fire.

The skills, in the skill tre there are many skills and branches that you can gain to better your odds of the tactic you most commonly use of working. From lunatic run and gun, to stealth and silence, to snipe and hide. From there down the road there are things like survival skills and trap making etc. I my self have taken a favor in the sniper side of thinks, i can hold my breath long, sight in fast, and ♥♥♥♥ my gun as fast as the bullet leaves the chamber.

Not even close to pay to win. This game has vary few things you can actually but in person it almost feels like the devlopers and creaters wanted to make a master peice they wanted to see people enjoy. One that i myself say if you get this instead of buying the weapons with your money buy a decal, a flag, a paint that best suites you, or a unique booster or boosters, to show how you enjoy and oppresiate what they have done for you and this game in a whole.

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Time for the down falls.

This game like i said is amazing. Practically adding new genre of games like Day Z. Mixing survival horror, mmorpg, pvp, and a open arms market to rig up your guy for any types of fights. Why could be wrong with this you may ask? well...


The Fps and ping isssiues, This is a common issiue for me and i myself have no idea why. My internet functions at light speeds for every game i have came across. I first thought it was a issiue with graphics. but that wouldnt make sence seeign how the 2 videos i did had been on medium settings and flew at a healthy 35-40 with a ping of 30-50. Now my game has slowly fell into a fps of 16-20 and a ping of 80- 128.

The starting errors. A bug that doesnt know when to stop. It comes at random and practically crips my computer to the point where i have to ctrl alt del for what feels like 100 times until it finally allows me to exit from the game. This bug is highly annoying and from the looks of the general chat which the bug doent allow you to type in the chat so your only allowed to read" Im not the only person who suffers from this.

The whisper of a crash. I name this. This is another bug that was kinda creepy and only sufferd it once yet was something i sorta dont want to see again for how strange and unsettaling it was. I went to start a match. It then told me it had found one. My character seemed to blink in and out of reality on the customization room and a static like noise dull in the background. Then the game crashed without even giving me a error report as if nothing happened. This should be investigated for i myself have no clue what it was.

Lastly the community. Something that i know alot of people are going uptight about but in all honesty i dont care. This needs to be addressed
date: not just for this game but all games. It seems like the gaming community has 1-2 types of people who have mass produced onto no just this but literally all games i play. Boarderline cardboard cut outs of each other. First the 12 year old group who play alot of Call of Duty. The ones who if you give a mic tend to scream hacker
hoursPlayed: and alot of cuss words that at times i believe they dont actually know the meaning of and even how to use them. The group that takes pride in annoying fellow memebers of there squads for literally no reason besides no one told them to play something else. Or even better for that age outside. And group 2. The groupi myself despise most. The "you mad bro" kids this group commonly merges

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'm not much a writer these days so this isn't going to be the most polished review but I'll try to be to the point.

Negative reviews tend to be by people who lack an understanding of how much work is required to make a good game and are clueless about the difference between development stage and finished product or by people who don't care enough to research the games they review. Not every negative review is going to be inept and I respect someone's right not to like a game.

While this game has problems they do not make this game a bad one. There are bugs (some brand new) that pop up, some of which are extremely annoying but not game breaking. Most guns do real damage in the game. While some guns need some tweaking (being more accurate than their real world counterparts) I hesitate to say any gun is truly OP. The premium guns are not P2W (extra ammo in a clip being the very minor exception). IMO all guns should be killers. So if anything, some guns are under powered. Pistol seem a bit weak, for instance.

The maps are mostly just the right size for P2P shooter.  They should create a spawn zone so that bullets cannot do damage either coming in or going out of the protected zone.  At least they have a small safety period when you spawn so you can't be shot. It's my opinion that a team that works together can defend the spawn and push the enemy back. Hence the importance of squads and voip in this game.

After reading up on the future plans for this game I must say that the devs are very thoughtful about what they are trying to do. I hope they get around to improving the graphics in this game as it looks like an older game sometimes. Im sure it's on their minds. They really seem care about this game and the people who play it. They also respond to my support tickets when a response is warranted.  I'm amazed at how patient they are with angry players
date: sometimes diffusing a player's anger with polite and honest answers.\n\nAs for hacks and cheats
recommended: every well known MP game is going to be under attack. I've personally seen at least one that I'm certain of.  VG doesn't make you jump thru hoops to report problem players; they consider reports seriously and take care of the offenders quickly
hoursPlayed: unlike some Devs who take weeks or months (if at all) to deal with reported cheaters and other problem players. I've experienced this personally."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

[ENG/RUS]
First hours impressions.
This is a multiplayer shooter, with look-through-ironsights-for-better-accuracy gameplay, buyable equipment, upgradable perks, no health regeneration, and only one gameplay mode right now.
It is a team deathmatch.
You shooting in neatly, very detailed maps based on CIS territory, with scifi accent from STALKER- anomalies, what can hurt you, interesting weather shenanigans, radiation, bleeding and other funzies.

Couple things: When someone shooting at you you have a great chance lose all blood and die from it. Fans of some-kind-of-realism will love it, but i prefer health regeneration so it was uncomfortable for me.
All buyble equipment, (and maybe, dunno for sure, perks) can be purchase for real money. And trust me- you better buy everything what you need unless you wanna spend hundreds of hours grinding little pieces of ingame money.
Couple things what i'll love to see in this game: Tutorial was great, especially explanation of controls in a first deathmatch. Those things saved me a lot of time.
So at additional it would be fantastic to see some special training maps with explanations, what could high up skill of player, to give him additional helpful information about gameplay mechanics, best strategies, places for practice, all the things what could make a real competitive player.
KillCam. Remember this Call of Duty feature? Add this in game.
Deathhud need information about,how much health your killer is have after your death, did he injured/ maimed somehow, what equipment and perks he have.
Lots of options for player; What map he wants to play, mods, equipments, bleeding, bonebreaking, all this checkboxes, radiobuttons, tiny scrollers, all this required to have good feelings from game. This is a part of customisation.
A much more obvious, intuitive understandable interface. In Windows 8, Mozilla Firefox, Google Chrome style as example. I personally was been confused, when i saw hard-to-reach weapons, and equipment what you have to drag and drop to your inventory.
More Loadout/weapon preference slots. 3 is max, by default you have only 2, and 3rd is for real money. Faster time to switch between them, 'cuz at this moment it is stuttering. Ability to copy-and-paste slot.
More stuff to do, what's make me happy. Gameplay mods, cool maps, interesting perks.
I don't like ironsights of UZI. So hard too see through them. Gimme better ironsights and scope and laserrrocket launcher! :D

Первые впечатления от игры.
Это мультиплеерный шутер, с смотри-в-прицел, чтобы-точнее-стрелять геймлеем, покупаемым снаряжением, развиваемыми перками, отсутствием регенерации здоровья, и пока одним геймплейным модом.
Это командный бой.
Стрельба в аккуратно проработанных, насыщенных нычками"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Survarium is a match based FPS game currently in beta testing.

The atmosphere of Survairum will be immediately familiar to people who have played the STALKER and metro games, as they share a similar vision and many of the same elements.

The gameplay at the moment is in the form of 5v5 matches based on the tier of your gear, and based on 4 different game modes, most of them are pretty standard like ctf, team deathmatch and conquest, but there is a free for all game mode which is actually pretty interesting. There is a freeplay game mode in the works that was promised for the end of 2015, although no one really knows when it will be released.

Not too many people are playing Survarium right now, and so matches can take a while to find, usually 3 minutes or so. You can speed this up by playing on all of the servers around the world, but if you do latency can become a BIG problem for you.

The quality of the visuals is somewhere between STALKER and Metro 2033, better in some areas than STALKER, worse than metro. Overall I think this game looks pretty good, and many of the maps are beautifully designed.

The game features a gear customization system that is satisfactory, with enough gear slots to make me feel like I have a good degree of control over how my character looks. There are also camos you can put on your clothes and decals you can put anywhere.

Overall, this game is pretty good for a beta, the business model so far has been good, and I dont feel like its really pay to win at all, and its one of the few games out there I know of that really feels like STALKER. Jerky player movement and lag can be a problem, but the next patch is supposed to help with that.

Thinking it through, the devs could've stick with stalker series, made another game, a solid single-player like they did before... let's hope this is just a side-project and they are working on something else out there.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had been playing this game for quite a while now and i had to write a review in this, This game is like a morning wake up game for me :P Here are some pros and Cons from my side. (Just my opinion) This review is also for the people who are going to play this for the first time.

First of all, The Pros:-
*The game is visually Amazing. Stunning graphics, Amazing lighting And a beautiful Environment. Overall, the game looks absolutly beautiful for a Free to paly game.
*The game has Seriously amazing sounds.
*The maps playable in the game are gorgeous. For the right amount of players in a mtach, Each and every map is fun.
*The stock wepons you get are awesome, Its the perfect wepons to start your first matches in Survarium
*The Faction system makes the game even better, each factions have its own rules and equipments.
*Clan and squad concept.
*Character skill system is wonderful and evenly distributed.
*There are alot of patches incoming everyday or every 2 days, and to be honest, the patch makes game more playable and fun everytime.
*Tactic - This is not COD. Seriously, it has much more stuff than shooting. I cant name it all.

Now for the cons:-
*Lag. The game is really laggy even though there are fairly alot of servers.
*Horrably Balanced. The matchmaking is Seriously not balanced at all.
*Gameplay is not smooth at all, with the lag its almost unplayable.
*Some wepons are the same, like there is not much difference between VSS and VSSK
*Team killing, yeah, this still exists and there is no punishment for doing so yet in the game.
*Spawn Camping. Game has nothing protect ourselfs from spawn campers.
*No prone .-. Seriously, there is snipeing. But cant prone.
*Game is really, really not optimized. For most of the players, Even with highend hardwares, its really laggy and not smooth enogh to play.

So 9 Pros and 8 Cons from my side. I do recomend this game Mainly because the game is still in beta version and most of the cons can be fixed with upcoming releases.
I'd give it 6/10 for now ;D

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is in open beta but crashes on a regular basis both loading a match and less often during.
I would have expected this to be fixed as a priority, but adding guns and maps seems to be more important.
This is more of an issue since the numbers on each team were lowered as AFK players cant win matches.
The game is free to play with a premium setting should you choose to spend real money on it.
Premium gives you increased cash and experience from a match. Repair costs and ammo are charged against your earnings. sound familiar?

The game is an arena at present two teams try to eliminate the most enemy or control the resources in a given time. Friendly fire is on. The maps are well thought out and very pretty to see. There are anomalies on these maps that are a hazard or a benefit if you can farm them. At the end of the game you get to loot a stash as a reward this may be anything from an emblem to go on your clothing to money, a gun or gear. As you play you gain character levels giving perks that improve your personal performance. You also gain rep that allows you to buy better gear and weapons with a faction.
You can also mod weapons and gear by spending roubles and parts from items you dismantle.
If you spend gold instead of roubles to mod an item success is a certainty. Mods are randomly determined and of random value between a range of values.

Freeplay and PVE variants have been promised forever but there is not much point picking up the game with an expectation of these modes at present.

Rep Level 0-4 was a blast I had great fun learning the game.
Rep Level 5 and it all changes it gets faster and more aggressive and often you feel out geared and gunned.
I am at rep level 8 and losing an average of 1000 roubles a match. I am not a great player but the chances of progressing without a premium account, buying gold or goodies at this point are slim and slow.

Real money can be spent on gold and on guns. Gold can be spent on guns and gear to help you progress. Golden weapons are generally resented and not only have a reload advantage they gain experience for the user at a higher rate. Gear bought with gold has an experience mod on it as well.

Since 29A was released servers are now split into North America, Russia and EU. The European servers are full of Russians and full of hackers. Since I wrote this real efforts have been made by VG to alliviate the issue and ban those caught.
This was not prevalent until the server separation. I cant speak for the American or Russian servers, but doubt they are fairing any better.

VG have an obsession with machine pistols and for some reason known only to themselves have made them high level, almost impossible to miss with and given them excessive range and the only downside is err...Lower level plavers get very frustrated being shot up with guns which can match their sniper rifles for accuracy, have better armour penetration and shoot 900rpm all with a 9mm pistol round. Oh did I mention they are suppressed as well. The game can feel like a bunny shoot where you are the bunny at times. Whatever arcane system matchmaking uses it can be absurdly unbalenced.

League matches are currently being played where players are rated in matches and move up or down leagues dependant on their score. if you finish in a higher league you get better loot at the end. I missed the last leagues but the reward for the players who killed the most was ofc an even better surpressed machine pistol. Please explain the logic...

If you choose to play expect your fun to be spoilt for a proportion of your matches by those who will know exactly where you are and who don't miss. They will try to bottle you up in your spawn.
Regardless of the gear you are in you cannot do well in this situation.
My honest belief is endemic hacking will destroy the player base and lack of evidence of further development of the game to a free play PVE mode is already disappointing many of the long term supporters of the project. This would be a great shame as what is promised has great potential.

The next upgrade is upon us 0.30a The game is less stable and crashes more often both on load and randomly. Starting the game either in spectator mode or with a black screen is an innovation I doubt VG intended. So along with the nailbiting is the game going to crash and deprive me of my loot the low level sniper rifles have been nerfed and there is a new I WIN button a Barrett anti material rifle you can run into opponants shooting barrets from the hip.
The good guns are now so ridiculous as to make the game a bunny shoot for those at rep level ten.
When you shoot someone at range with a sniper rifle 3 times and they kill you with a machine pistol you really know the physics (or logic) is out of control.
I can no longer report cheaters as my complaints are all used up. Another compelling reason to give up on the game. VG have banned several hundred cheaters and have scraped the surface of the problem, but certainly not fixed it. Nor will they by stopping them being reported. EDIT: This was apparently not deliberate and has been turned back on.

0.42A is with us and I wonder why I still play. The game is a lot and I mean a lot shinier,and rarely crashes but real issues are still not being addressed. Cheating is really bad at present and random sync/lag issues are making some matches unplayable. Match making is poor in getting a balence and a lot of matches are a rout. The league is currently on and cheats are running amok to get the ranks. The game is unplayable for the next couple of weeks as to gain a league position requires 5 wins with a loss knocking you back down a point. I am maybe seeing 1 win in five and idiocy like one squad of three getting 90% of the kills in a match. some games almost no kills to 15 deaths then a good one back to 13-8. Variance like this was unusual in the past. Now certain players can stop running aim and kill you before you can shoot an aimed gun.
VG keep saying how effective anticheat is instead of addressing the fact that a sizeable minority of players are ruining the game and being rewarded for doing so.

I would really love to be able to recommend the game and hope to do so at some point in the future when the necessary fixes and anticheat are in place and promised development has occurred. Reality is cheating is endemic and likely always will be and the developers are more interested in making it shiny than making it work.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Okay I believe I've played a decent amount of hours to review this.

PROS
- Great Graphics and optimization.
- Nice maps, some are open and I like the addition of Radiation in some points.
- Weapon sounds are amazing.
- Customization looks impressive, it has potential.
- This game is far from P2P at the moment, in game currency is earned quite easily with the challenges etc.
- For an Alpha it has quite a few game modes (Cannot wait for the survival game mode)
- Barely any server lag.
- Cool menu system and UI.
- Factions seem interesting.
- Haven't yet come across any hackers.
- Ingame Clan Creation.
- Team Based combat.

CONS
- Lots of AFK players which can't be kicked or voted to be kicked.
- Team killing is an issue, there is no voting system and team killers aren't kicked.
- For the moment there is a lack of weaponry.
- Crashes for some people, my friends have had several game crashes which I am yet to experience.
- When you get shot you may bleed, to bandage you have to purchase bandages in the store for free to play currency.

All in all the Pros heavily outweigh the Cons and I can definitely see potential in this game, it reminds me of Red Orchestra 2.

If you like fast paced FPS don't play this as this is quite a tactical game in terms of combat.

I recommend.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I can see this being the game I accidentally stay up until 5 in the morning playing.

Survarium is an early access, post-apocalyptic FPS. It is Free to Play, but unlike most F2P games, it's also Free to Enjoy. I haven't put too many hours into it yet as I installed it the day of writing this, but I  definitely will. It's matches are short (about 10 minutes) bvut packed with action. You pick your play style by using a loadout system. For example, my current loadouts are a Mosin Nagant (free when you start playing, 1 shot to the torso) and a handgun, and an Uzi with a handgun. After death, you can switch which loadout you're using, so if you get bored of sneaking and long-range combat, you can easily witch to a run-n-gun style. I will not EVER put money into this game, and as I see it now, that won't effect how I enjoy the game. One of the features that is supposed to get you so hand over cash I actually ENJOY being in the game: If you get shot for a large amount of damage, you'll bleed out over time. If you still have 25% HP, you'll live, but it is very easy to be injured fatally.

The game is beautiful, well optimized, and fun. 8/10.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Survarium is an attempt at reviving the S.T.A.L.K.E.R series, which they are doing in an MMOFPS format. This attempt is a brave one and so far the game is decent for a beta.

When you first login, you go through a little tutorial that shows you the very basics of Survarium. After the tutorial you choose either the Scavangers or the Black Market faction. Once one of these factions is at level five, you can then start progressing into the other two factions: The Renaissance Army and The Fringe Settlers. You can switch between these factions at any time and in next update there will be no prerequisite to join the other two factions. Each faction has its own unique gear you can unlock and buy with the regular in-game currency, which is Rubles. Gear can also be attained via random drop at the end of a match.

Separate from faction levels, there are also character levels. Each level you will need 250XP more than the previous, to advance to the next level. Each time you level up, you get a skill point which can be put into the two available skill trees. There will be a total of five skill trees in the future. Currently, the maximum character level that can be attained is 100, however, when the other three skill trees become available, this number will increase to 500.

Currently there is one game mode called PVP" which hosts 16 players in total
date:
two teams of eight. This PVP game mode has three sub-modes in it which are:
Protective Device (Capture the flag spin-off)
Team Deathmatch (Self-explanatory)
Research (Conquest-type game mode with three capturable objectives)There are plans to introduce “free game” mode which will feature a large-scale map. Co-op modes have also been confirmed. All game modes are session-based and will not feature hundreds of players on one map. I’m not sure how I feel about this but I have confidence that Vostok Games will do it right.

Free-to-Play model
There are quite a few people that think this game is pay-to-win. I’m not going to say they are right or wrong but I will give my honest opinion on it.

The premium-account provides you with one extra profile slot
hoursPlayed: +50% reputation towards faction rank
voteText: and +50% Rubles income from matches.\n\nPremium itself is actually fairly cheap. One-year premium is 5
helpfulPercent: 000 gold
votesHelpful: which is $50 USD. This is quite reasonable considering your average MMO subscription fee is $15 USD a month which would end up around $180 USD per annum. Mind you
votesTotal: you do not have to buy a year at a time. You can purchase premium in increments of 24 hours
votesFunny: three days
commentsCount: a week
column16: a month
column17: three months
column18: six months or the year mentioned before. So far I purchased three-day premium once for 120 gold which translates into $1.20 USD.\n\nPremium guns however
column19: are quite expensive and don’t offer any advantage that is worth that price. Premium guns do not alter damage of the weapon but have boosts like +10% fire rate or +10% reload speed. I think this is a quite reasonable approach to combat the pay-to-win stereotypes.\n\nI should also mention that without spending any real money
column20:
you can get these same +10% boosts on your weapons by upgrading them. They just won’t have the skins that the premium guns do.

Verdict
Overall
column21: this is a humble approach to a free-to-play MMOFPS. If you are expecting a polished game then you will be disappointed
column22: but if you embrace the fact that this is still a beta
column23: with a small development team which for the time being will mean a long development process
column24: then you just might enjoy it.\n\nSurvarium is worth a try
column25: it is free after all and it deserves more people in its community. Go ahead and install it. What’s the worst that will happen? You’ll actually like the game?"
column26: April 8, 2015
column27: true

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Since this is an Early Access title, this is more of a first impression.
PvP is fun, but it gets very unbalanced. Accuracy is very iffy and the damage mechanics are weird. You can hit someone dead on with a Mosin and they can shrug it off while killing you instantly with an SMG. Those are my main complaints though. I hope they are able to open up a small PvE section soon, I am very much looking forward to that.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Survarium takes place in the future of 2050, where a majority of Ukraine has been radiated by various sources. The war for the donetsk region of Ukraine still rages on, even though the world has gone to bitter ♥♥♥♥. Due to radiation, and the decrease of population in both sides, they have taken part in something straight out of a science fiction novel.
To continue the conflict, both sides have taken part to an illegal cloning project, which has spun out of control. The cloning produces millions, upon millions of middle aged men. And due to a unfortunate mishappening, each clone came with a copy of a Mosine and a Ppsh-41. With the coming uprising, the clones have taken control of both Ukraine Parliament, and Donetsk's Parliament.
With the end of the old world governments, you would think that both sides could come to an agreement, but no. Old grudges never go away. They declare war on each other, and send all their forces to attack each other. That's where you, the player, come in.


You take control of one of these mindless clones. You start out with a wool sweater, a PPSH-41, a Mosine, and a TT-34 for your sidearm. Unfortunely, your clone doesn't not come with a voice box, so you can not communicate with your allies vocally. You need to use hand signals to be able to communicate with them.


The combat is unique, accurately depicting the true struggles in the Ukrainian conflict. Everyone looks the same. Both sides have the same weapons, and the same sweaters. It's just like the real life counterpart, having both sides shoot each other while they have the same uniforms and weapons.
Shooting people isn't too hard, as each time you win a round you 'level up'. This means you are able augment your clone in to a type of super soldier unseen in modern warfare.
Dying isn't also a pain either, as each time you die a cloaked Matter Replicator brings a new you back to life to fight again.

The shop in game allows you to exchange US currency to a type of digital gold, to russian rubles. You can use the digital gold/rubles to further augment your clone, buy old world weapons/armor, or buy flags (Such as USSR, Russian Federation, Russian Seperatists, Ukraine, etc.). It is unknown in the story where the supplies come from, but the developers have hinted that Russia is supplying the clones. It has yet to be confirmed or canon.

My personal opinion is that it's an alright game depicting real life events, and a scenario which can happen in the future.
The clone I currently own is a level 20 Commissar, equipped with a gasmask linked to a gasoline canister, so that I can inhale the gas fumes and have supersoldier strength.

I would recommend this game to anyone who wants to see what it is like fighting on the front lines of the Ukraine Civil War. Thank you for this beautiful game.

EDIT:
A hardship I forgot to mention in my review is that the clones are constantly bullied by russian millionaries, trying to peer pressure them in to buying a gun worth 60 CAD just to not be called a poor-♥♥♥".

https://a.pomf.se/vglewr.png







Seriously don't even consider playing this game"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A first-person shooter set in an overgrown, post apocalyptic shooter. The guns act very good for this stage in the development, they are loud (as they should be) and a good hit will put you, or your enemy, down for the count. The uniforms camoflague with the background very well, so it gives one that paranoid 'anyone could be lining their sites up on me right now' vibe. The hit detection is spot-on and the mechanics while not unique as a whole are unique in how they are placed and used. Not to mention that there are plans for a free roam mode. Micro-transactions are definitely there, but so far don't seem to be a hinderence and dont give a pay-to-win feel. However, this may change as the development continues, for better or worse.

All in all, a good game, better than some paid games i own, and it's free. Recommended.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Survarium is being developed by members of the original STALKER team, and it shows. Its ultimate goal is to become an MMOFPS, with similar atmosphere and setting to STALKER. That said, don't come into this game expecting STALKER. It's solely PVP, there are no monsters, the weapons are varied but hard to get (think more like how armor was distributed in the STALKER series). However, what's present in Survarium clearly benefits from the quirks and philosophy of the original team.

The game is an intense, thoughtful multiplayer shooter with a heavy emphasis on positioning, hiding/camouflage, resource management, and smart play. Teamwork and patience are greatly rewarded. The maps are huge, each containing 2-5 discrete areas that could, in another game, be a full map. Long-range combat is common and satisfying.

The graphics are technically so-so, but the effect is greater than the sum of its parts. The world is lush with foliage, and the lighting, while inconsistent, sometimes comes together to create some of the most immersive environments in gaming. I've never felt more aware or concerned with camouflage in a game, and finding a good sniper spot or route through cover feels completely instinctual. The sound is PHENOMENAL.

Survarium is free-to-play, so there's a good amount of weapons and armor and so forth that you can pay real money for, but I haven't felt unfairly outclassed by a paying player yet. The atmosphere is currently daytime
recommended: which is a little disappointing. It would do great with weather effects, more time-of-day variety, etc.\n\nThe bottom line is that this game is a great distillation of STALKER's human v. human combat, with a lot of potential improvements to come. Give it a shot.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Cons:
- Loads of hackers. Mostly Russian.
- No proper anti-cheat - People are getting banned from time to time, but they can just make a new account in 5 minutes and come back.
- Hit detection is random as hell
- Not many players (Probably due to beta phase and hackers)
- Bulk of players are apparently non English reading/typing Russians
- Weapon balance is bad at certain tiers.
- Getting stuck on all kinds of small terrain objects.

Pros:
- If you get a match without cheaters, its great fun as the match swings back and forth!
- Game runs reasonably well (but has an uncommon random disconnect and wildly swinging FPS bugs)
- Welcome variety of maps (but with imbalances in obstacle/path placement - Some maps favor one side too much)


NOT RECOMMENDED at the moment.
Put it on follow and wait till the community confirms a proper automated anti-cheat is in place and working.
At the moment, as far as I know, cheater reports are processed Manually O.O
There is a low limit of reports a player can send per day. After that..too bad if you see a cheater.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Cheaters plague this game like flies on .... well you know. Your always going to have cheaters in online games,  Do they actively ban cheaters? sometimes, but they are able to come back the very next day with a new account.

The second issue I have with this game is the player matching that can sometimes take up to 30 min bofore playing a match. I mean come on, I'm getting bored waiting.

The Third issue I have with the game is player balancing. ATM of this writing the matches are based off of teir levels (gear lvl), not player levels so a new player can come into the game and be only  Teir 2 level 4 only to find himself playing against several Tier 2 level 40+. Now why does this matter? well a level 40+ player has alot more skills the affect his performance then the level 4 guy does. Like 20 or more skills. way unbalanced.

For some reason the developers feel they need to develop more eye candy and un important updates (like new lobby map and new artifacts) over things that will help bring in more fans and keep them here, Like anti-cheat solutions and new player matching and balancing.

Other than that game plays great when everything falls into  place. Unfortunaly I can not recommend this game at this time. Advanced Gamers will not stay for more than 10 days, average gamers will get sickend, and N00bs, will get frustrated . Just wish it didn't feel like our voices to the developers, fell on deaf ears. I mean  we are all techniclly beta testers, it is a beta game after all)

Hope they fix.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

very motivating and fun to play. The gameplay and weaponhandling feels a bit like old call of duty games but a bit more tactical. the maps are cool. They are well designed and have potential to give some great fights and classic matches. The atmosphere is great also and gives you a good, authentic post-apocalypse, stalker-like feeling. But the best of all: the character development features and dashmap feature. To have the opportunity to find some great new weapons or armors is very cool and motivating. Overall i would say the game has GREAT potential.

Contra: Some weapons are a bit unbalanced at this point. The performance requirements are way too high for a shooter like this in my opinion. Even at the lowest settings I got poor framerates, an my computer is not that worse. I can play most of the current games fine on mid - high settings with stable framerates. But suvarium unfortunately, brings my computer down on the knees.
On the one hand a bunch of weapon sounds are AMAZING and feel damn realistic. On the other hand, some other weapons sound completly unrealistic (for example some shotguns and granades) and the sound just does not fit to the gun. I really hope that the developers will fix this from time to time.
Also I got the feeling that sometimes the hitboxes or hit-feedback is not the best at all. But I dont know if its the hit feedback or my bad aiming skills haha. I just get the feeling that something could be better and smoother here.

But overall. The features are very cool and have very very much potential! If the developer could fix those problems" and fill the last empty gaps in this game
date: it could become a really really good multiplayer shooter. For me personaly its already one of my favorites !\n\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As a longtime enthusiast of the Stalker series, I naturally wanted to check this game out as soon as I could. Right now, there's only PvP (Team Deathmatch, Research, Battery Retrieval) available, with other modes like Freeplay PvE and co-op modes planned for the future. The matches take place in the sort of bleak environments you'd expect: scarred landscapes with crumbling rock walls, ruined buildings, abandoned vehicles, and overgrown vegetation.

The game looks pretty good. The character models are fairly plain and the animations aren't particularly well done, but I like the look and atmosphere of the world itself. None of it really feels too much like a Stalker game, except for the anomalous areas of the map, which are extremely hazardous to blunder into and made me wish I could stop the match, shoulder my rifle, get out an artifact detector, and hunt for a Night Star or a Moonlight or a Mama's Beads.

As for combat, the guns are loud and startling and bullets quickly shred you to pieces. It's the sort of quick-death scenario that should inspire slow and careful advances through the map and tactical cooperation with other players on your team, but honestly, right now, everyone seems content to just run at top speed all over the map and shoot each other in the face. The maps themselves aren't designed particularly well for Team Deathmatch, though. If one team pushes in far enough, they'll basically swarm the other end and just spawnkill everyone, and the match timers feel a bit too long.

What also concerns me a bit is that it seems to be entirely matchmaking driven. I don’t want matchmaking, I want server browser. There’s an option to join games as part of a squad, which helps with getting friends into the game, but I still want more freedom and more options. I get that a lot of games run their own servers and want to control things to make the experience smoother, but I’d really like the trend of relieving players of control and choice to turn back. In this case I also assume the level-based systems make it so that high level characters will mince the newbies, but it still does work against making me want to stay.

All in all this is a broad, ambitious start. What this is not, however, is the part of Survarium which is actually interesting. Because the truth is that I have played many, many competent and pretty multiplayer FPS games in recent months/years. I’ve enjoyed them, of course, but I haven’t stuck around for most. Some of them have been Free-to-play, and others not. Survarium lies somewhere between Warface and the Tripwire games in both its delivery and its execution, which means that it’s relatively unusual, but also looking at competition from both crowds. As a straight up multiplayer FPS (which is all it is as of now), it’s not going to stand out from the many extraordinarily well-featured FPS games we now have available to us. The level-based stats improvement and unlock system are a pretty familiar thing nowadays, so screwing around in inventory world (and having to make sure you're well dressed and armed for your fight) comes as no surprise.

That said, perhaps the sheer desire for this kind of world and setting, as well as the seemingly limitless enthusiasm of East European markets for brutal hardcore FPS games, will see it through. I hope so, because it’s a game I want to see grow and mature.

In conclusion, it’s promising. And I say promising not because I expect this PvP part of the game to become a shining gem, but rather that it might be indicative of the quality of the as-yet-unseen Freeplay and Co-op game modes which Vostok have said will arrive at a later date. That quality could potentially be enormously high. I just hope that they’ve done this the right way around. Surely it was wise to create a proof of concept their tech and combat mechanics in a straightforward game mode like this, but I hope that it doesn’t find itself foundering in competitive waters before it gets to the stuff that genuinely makes the Survarium world an exciting prospect.

I try not to compare this to Stalker too much, but if Vostok’s first game does emerge as an online successor to the Stalker games, then they will have achieved much. Stalker, of course, had a decent multiplayer component too, but it was never that part of the game which truly captured our imaginations.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Pretty good for .27. I mean the only things to rage about that are legit are real FPS problems. Like people cry about spawn camping, but that is a classic part of FPS, I mean I know the new ones hold your hand and there are kids complaining who can't afford a real game but come on if you haven't had to fight your way out of a bad sitution or lost a battle in an FPS badly then you really haven't played any good ones. I mean I have been camped 3 times 2 of those times I was able to help push them back, and we had a good match still lost but we didn't give up and shift tab still in a match to complain or write reveiws so we got out of the spawn area and still had a fighting chance to get some kills and exp.

Another complaint I read is its 8x8 with random maps, that is how most FPS were, and some still are. I know the new age shiny gamer doesn't like this, they only want to learn to play one map, but its .27 you kind of have to have people play every map to you know figure out how the maps need to be changed if they do. It goes right into the whole they only want to play to win, not to play mentality I guess. Some maps I do not like but each time I play I figure out more and more of it, and how I can play it better this is called FPS gaming.

The game is server side so sniping and aiming requires remembering there is a tiny delay as the server says you shot them not your computer so sniping takes a little more skill, and practice and requires you to lead a little on moving targets since depeding on server ping you may just bearly miss that headshot. Sadly this makes SMGs all the rage of low tier combat, but there a few good snipers out there, and I kind of prefer the sniper to be rare, and annoying as hell with skilled ones doing quite well for themselves. Anyways traditional hacks don't work at all as of right now only ESP hacks work the weakest of all hacks, and they claim to have a good system in place to track those who scan data to ESP hack, and even do a ban list as proof they are catching the few hackers.

The last one every one has taken a swing at, the P2P means P2W, I haven't seen this once in game and already reading threads about people not happy that they can't buy cooler stuff that the stuff is actualy too weak for them to want to buy it. To me that is a plus, the bonus of paid gun is increased coin earning with it, but people still want an OP gun that will carry them from tier 1 to tier 6 saddly. But rest assured this isn't in the game, I saw some one claim there was a shotgun that was OP, I killed 2 people with that shotgun using a lvl 2  SMG at close range, they quickly ditched the shotgun and swaped to SMGs to fight using their other profiles gun.

I dun wanna talk about much of the game itself. I do want to however address concerns of it being P2W. Because it is, and it isn't. reviewText:
Early Access Review

Survarium was fun when you fought other players with low level gear. But then you leveled up.
Guys with top tier paid assault rifles one shot you while you shoot at them with a low class bolt action.
Shotguns can take down players from a sniper rifle's range.

Pros:
kinda fun gunplay
Maps are large, anomalies is an innovative idea

Cons:
Very long wait time for a match
Extremely unbalanced between close levels (i.e. level 3 and level 4)
Extremely unbalanced weapons (those semi auto shotguns I ♥♥♥♥ing love it)
Pay 2 Win: pay and get top tier gear you basically dominate the game
Progression is extremely slow

Would not recommmend if you are used to FPS like Battlefield or even CoD

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'll be giving this a solid 8/10.

I'm not into the whole beta access thing etc, bar a few MMOs,  so I dont know how much more work is getting put into this game before it's considered finsihed. But as it stands the game is an incredibly fun, fast paced yet still tactical game that any fps gamer or certainly any post-apoc genre fan should give a go.

The maps are interesting, expansive, good fun to explore and master with countless bottlenecks, sniping positions and storming points for players of all preferences to master; the weather changes and this has a vast effect on the maps themselves, forcing players to adapt. They include anomalies and radiation zones, poison clouds and all other manner of environmental forces that, when coupled with beartraps of thoughtful positioning make for a real challenge.

The Character customisation is a dream for the more rolaplying, kit orientated players (like myself). the choice is finite, albeit within four factions, two of which are open at the beginning of the game. select your gun, your clothing and kit, and off you go. it's quick, but in depth enough that you get the feel of a proper loadout. there are masses of guns and armour throughout the reputation stages, unlocked and then bought by grinding rep and currency. The end tier stuff looks amazing to me, which makes me want to continue playing.

The actual FPS capabilities of the game are very good. its well balanced and matched well to the maps, meaning everyone can play their own style, be it support, sniper or assault. its twitchy, visceral and VERY lethal, very realisitic. reminiscent of red orchestra, if not identical. you can attempt to heal yourself through kit, but honestly one shot is enough to have you scrambling back to cover and praying you dont bleed out. the gun sound effects are crisp and if you are carfeul you can tell which way battle or enemies lie which is a plus.

graphically, I found it a touch grainy regardless of a settings change; that said it doesnt look awful at all. it just means that at extreme distances it becomes hard to aim at enemies because thy begin to blur and pixxelate.

The 8/10 reflects that I would like to see more armour choices and perhaps physical customisation impemented, like bein able to choose items like knives or trophies" to attach at points to your character. It also reflects that It has begun to become a bit stale after only a few hours of play
date: the fact being that ive ecplored a lot of the content that the game offers even after such a short time playing.\n\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

My current thoughts on this game is that this game is definitely worth installing. Most of the problems listed in the other reviews are not a problem for me.

Pros:
- Great graphics and sound
- Guns feel more like actual guns rather than peashooters
- Decent progression
- Solid gameplay
- Unrestricted customization (No classes)
- Maps are nicely made, both in scenery and layout

Cons:
- Some maps feel a bit too small while some others feel a bit too large
- Poorly optimized, runs a bit slow even on Minimal, should be easy for the devs to iron out in a couple updates
- Frequent crashes, 2 of my 3 game sessions ended that way
- Spawns are very open, possible to get shot dead as soon as you spawn
- Very difficult to join anything other than Team Deathmatch (at least I haven't been able to join one yet)

Overall it's a decent game, still in early access. Free Roam will come eventually which will definitely add a lot more new content. I haven't seen any Pay 2 Win yet, and I don't think there really is any at all in the game's current state.

Edit: I can't even play this game right now because it crashes less than a few minutes in. It's still a pretty good game but Vostok Games needs to prioritize optimization and fixing crashes before anything else.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun to play and very gorgeous game. Gameplay is a mix of online PVP game types and is pretty standard. What really shines is the amazing graphics and very simple but polished movement and gunning. Maps usually have cramped tight spaces and wide open areas. The guns all have long range and high damage that makes engagements short and tense at close range, at long range the environment allows for a lot of use of cover and concealment and feels like a more tactical game.

The currency system seems expense for real money investments, but I've been getting free currency after every match at a pretty good rate. There some items that are paid currency only, but there are a bunch of free currency items that you can buy. The guns are all so high damage that I doubt that any paid guns or armor could be better" than the free ones. So that's nice.

TLDR:Awesome online PVP shooter

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've been playing this game on and off since i got my key ages ago. I can say while it's advancing slowly, the devs are doing an amazing job.
I won't write a wall of text but only want to point out pros and cons, and also say that you should try the game yourself and not believe the negative reviews, these people don't know what they talk about at all.

Pros
- Atmosphere
- Weapon detail
- Shooting mechanics
- Talent trees
- MMORPG structure
- Anomalies
- Sense of survival
- Hardcore gameplay
- Unforgiving
- Free items every end of the match
- Easy to get into but hard to master
- Very rewarding
- Not Pay2Win at all (unlike what people say, the purchaseable weapons are on the high end of mediocre at best)

Cons
- Could use more advertising
- Queues can be up to 5 minutes after 2AM GMT+2
- Matchmaking can sometimes match you with high geared players if you have a higher level equipment equipped
- Non moddable weapons (scopes etc) for now.

This game is worth a try, there is lots to do, leveling up your STALKER, assigning talent trees, getting reputation with your favourite faction in order to unlock awesome equipment and much more !

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I'd say this game is far from perfect, right off the bat. There are netcode issues and the game still isn't fully optimized (my FPS goes to hell on two maps in particular, but stays at a stable 60-70 on every other).

Unlike other FTP games, the pay-for weaponry isn't any better than the ones you can earn, aside from perhaps one slightly useful stat which, if you're lucky, you can get when you upgrade the normal variant, and aren't stuck with two other semi-useless traits (let's face it, reliability isn't all that useful as of right now).

I'm on the same train of thought as everyone else in one aspect: give me freemode! But unlike others, I can wait. I'd rather they release a more whole product than a completely unfinished version of it, as people nowadays are as likely to flock away from an unfinished product in beta as they are in full release.

In short, if you don't mind an arena-like shooter with somewhat realistic mechanics and some technical issues, I'd recommend this. If you are having problems dying to SMGs or the like (as of 2.7), I recommend coming back with the next update, where every faction and several guns are being rebalanced.

Edit as of 2.8: Okay, so 2.8 hit and the game has been rebalanced. I see far more variety of weapons in the field, and that is fantastic; no more is the rifle-SMG combo dominating til super high tiers. Now I see shotguns, SMGs, rifles, assault rifles, etc - all of them and beyond. But, not all is sunshine and rainbows.

North American servers are still MIA, and as a North American player, I'm one of those suffering from it. Not to mention hit detection and the like. Still, I can keep my vote positive if only due to my only like of the game - but everyone should take it with a slight grain of salt at this point in time.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Being a huge S.T.A.L.K.E.R fan and seeing devs' claim that they will build this game on community's feedback, encouraged me to give Survarium a shot and hope to contribute with one of thousand other helpful community feedbacks. So, here's a helpful review (hopefully) to Steam users and developers

First of all, this game is not finished. It's still in early access and it still lacks a lot of content that a game of this ambition and potential needs.

The good:

When it comes down to equipment, this game does certainly not lack. There is a full arsenal of well known and not so well known Russian weapons (predominantly). The guns are attractive, and the sound of the guns feel great, the shots echo through the map very nicely, much like in Ghost Recon:Phantoms. Weapons bought with real money do not give players advantage over players that have weapons bought by in-game currency (90% of the guns are bought by in game currency). Devs have announced that they will implement weapon modding, and from what i have seen, it will be very detailed, and it only benefits the game. Level design is highly comparable to that of S.T.A.L.K.E.R. The sheer size of maps could make them a great plot setting. Matches do take a life of their own, but it mostly comes down to snipers hiding away in a bush and people buzzing through choke points with rifles. This is something that some people won't like, but i kind of like the open-ness of Survarium; there are a lot of different routes a player can take to flank his enemies. It's not an action-packed sprayfest and i'm totally OK with that. I play this game completely relaxed, with no need to rush anywhere or be mad at anyone, which most online shooters will make you do.

Some other thoughts/the bad:

Menu design and interface could be done a lot better, tho. The system's simple enough, and presentation should be simple as well. How it is now, it's pretty confusing to most of new players out there. Design is VERY IMPORTANT, in every product! Weapon upgrade system is practically a big gamble on your in game currency, and i don't like it that way. The game's not too well-optimized, nor does it support voice comms yet.

Artifact hunt just doesn't pay off. Artifacts can give you a temporary boost of attributes for the length of the match, but i find having 3 medkits much more useful than having a random artifact in your inventory instead. And if you want artifacts, you have to give up medkit slots, because artifact detector takes up the slots reserved for medkits. I find this kind of ironic because i got the idea that the developers actually wanted to make artifact hunt one of the primary interests for players in the game, which is not the case.

The trouble is, the thing i like the most about this game is potential. Can Vostok make the most of it? Time will tell.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As it clearly says in this review and on the store page (as of this reviews writing) it is Early Access. Developement takes time and patience. bug fixing and listening to our complaints and cheers. Understand these are well seasoned game makers and they know how to do their jobs. it is not easy making a game that suits every single player. thank you.

TL;DR

In just a few hours of playing i have already gotten 1 item from the end of match random loot that would have required me to level up a different faction to purchase it. I really like it regardless of the iffy reviews :) not to mention I am not too fond of team vs team PVP in a confined area. Though the map sizes and numerous paths you can take do help. Hopefully they will soon be announcing the PVE/Co-op/Story mode they mentioned early on.

Review

Looking for a shooter with a cash shop that actually doesnt go fully to end game gear? Survarium has just that! the gear you can earn by leveling up a faction is far superior to the items found in the cash shop :) Sure there are some items that give wallet warriors an upper hand but in most cases unless its a clean headshot, you still have a chance to shoot back.

Good

•Selectable server region with ping and player display - choose how far you are willing to reach for your matchmaking - click below the Play button in-game to choose your best ping options
•Dynamic matchmaking that tries to compensate for the number of players searching - you may end up with some lower or higher levels on your team/opposing team
•Great atmosphere
•Plenty of places to hide
•A chance (or chances if you use premium currency) to get random loot drops at the end of each match - quite often spare parts for upgrading your gear and a chance to get some decent gear too!
•Upgradeable gear with either currency - enhance your gear or take it apart for upgrading other gear!
•Basic semi self healing with visual display of injuries - items can boost this and other elements
•Kill or Scare you opponents by disabling their limbs and even hands
•Build your character to handle situations you want - Hide in an anomoly and become immune to it then lure enemies that havent chosen that path into it and giggle while doing so
•Cash shop that is fair and doesnt offer endgame gear - you can also earn free premium currency by doing things within the game
•Items in the cash only shop require you to level up! - No right off the tutorial wallet warriors! They have to earn it first!
•Not everything in the 'shop' is cash only - it is a combined in-game currency shop as well
•High ping auto freeze/position correction - halts Disconnectors from getting an edge in fights

Bad

•Dynamic matchmaking system can occasionally make the fight hard if you are low - mid level
•Sometimes long que wait times while the matchmaking tries to find you a spot
•Cash shop (no end game show stopping gear - you can earn better gear than the shop offers)
•Sometimes glitchy visuals on anomolies
•no PVE/Co-op other than the usual team play (as of this review)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

List of Cons

-You cannot control the volume.
-Weapons are still unbalanced after a YEAR of beta testing.
-There are suspected ESP hackers around who cannot be caught because VG obviously cannot come up with dedicated anti cheat while developing a full game.
-On lower end game unbalance is edged towards submachine guns such as kiparis, while on higher end games vssk and pechneg dominate games. If everyone had the same guns it would be boring but balanced. The issue is lower level players are being paired against such players due to lack of playerbase which results in equipment combinations that are game breaking.
-There are no meaningful camo options in shop for example the ghillie suit from fringe settler is glitched and looks like a glowing white jellyfish from a distance.
-Lack of NA servers making the game unplayable on higher tiers where first to shoot usually wins in light of high damage weapons.
-Players who do play are grinding gear in anticipation of freeplay and co-op. If news comes that a freeplay or co-op account is a totally seperate profile with seperate ranks the vast majority of the already small fanbase will quit the game.

pros-
-looks kind of like stalker
-there are some people still playing the game
-an update is coming
-free play might be here at Christmas
-on level 1 games you can own new players if you have even minutely better equipment and farm your way to higher levels if need be by purposefully wearing worthless equips. PPSH VS KIPARIS w/ ap rounds LOLOLOLOLOL.
-Hiding in foilage works against legit players.
-Sniping kills in one hit allowing you to cause other players to rage, you may even shoot legs to cripple people for humor.
-melee kills in one hit by touching, not hitting enemies in kevlar or even BOMB SUIT with a buttstroke. (a naked level 1 noob can kill a lv 15 guy with a buttstroke yes)
-game will not all a sudden get freeplay so if you rank up now you will be unstoppable in 1 or 2 years when the game releases freeplay.
-team killing has no consequences as at level 1 with a ppsh everything is FREE. As in Free to play!
-no NA servers so EU players can stomp new NA players like Kratos in god of war due to better connection.
-bear traps and lots of them, you can infact stack up to 4-5 allowing you to kill any player who does not see them.
-If you shoot people in the hands they flop like a fish in a barrel not being able to do anything.
- revisiting snipers you can shoot people even team mates in the feet to cripple them.
- spawn camping the other team allows for faster progression and is infact an endorsed position by devs who actually have a guide teaching you how to spawn camp <- go surviarium guides.
-There are lots of afks at times in certain games allowing the smart player to sneak in enemy spawn and just melee camp <- highly reccomending for power leveling.
-If you really have to you can buy a premium vsk-94 and go on rekting players YES LEVEL 1 WITH LV 14 GUN CAN BE PRO STATUS very reccomended. Infact the VSS vintorez pay version will soon have 20 round mag in new patch while regular only has 10. -once you reach lv 15 you become super soldier and can walk around with pkm like call of duty 2 juggernaut causing earthquake tsunami and tribulation to new and old players alike NO ONE CAN ESCAPE YOU WHO CAN MAKE WAR WITH YOU? lolololol.
-maps are so big you can run across in about 18 seconds if you are ninja. good news is most new people do not know maps so you can be like Predator and stalk new people with impunity!


in short VERY VERY recommended game bestest game ever. If you are not playing this now you must make time for it!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A very good game. Survarium has a feeling of the good-ol' FPS games (CoD, CoD2 and more) mixing fast-pace and tactical feeling, coplex mechanics (bleeding, breath and so on), RPG elements and 3-dimensional map design. Survarium is as much about surviving as finishing your objectives.

Although PVP is very fun, with interesting modes and TDM (Team Deathmatch), I can't wait to play the open-world mode, which is said to increase the level of complexity with the character building and gameplay.

With the more tactical feeling than other FPS games around, I would like to see some features added, such as leaning (peeking over to the left or right), prone (should add yet another way of surviving), weapon attachments (to increase further the way to modify and upgrade a weapon), team-mate healing (essentially giving the option to become a medic) and more weapons, armor and factions (weapons from all around the world and such).

Map and match-making needs slight improvements aswell. Often times, teams are not equal skill-based, leading to 'ownage' of the weaker team. It seems like adding layers of comparison between players (K/D ratio, W/L ratio and such) would improve match-making.
Map design is great for the most part. Spawn locations and the easy way for the opponents to access them is problematic. Even though there are systems which defend new spawned players (you can't damage someone who just spawned or something like that), 'spawn ♥♥♥♥♥♥' is definitely a thing you see from time to time, especially with poor-made and unequal skilled matches.

Survarium is definitely a recommend, with great gameplay now and many things to look for.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Introduction            	Survarium is an online, free to play, FPS game with a post-apocalyptic style. The first thing I would like to say is that the community is great around this game. The few interactions I have had with the in game player have been very enjoyable and the player seem very enthusiastic about Survarium. While being free to play Survarium is far from pay to win. This being said you can buy nearly everything in the game at the beginning with real life currency, but CANNOT buy weapons or anything that allows you to have a great advantage other players. The only thing you can buy in this game is fast track to unlocks and customizations.
Right now Survarium is just a team based fps, but the devs have said they are planning to add more content as well as a freeplay (PvE) mode. Right now Survarium is just a typical fps game with different gamemodes but the freeplay mode is really what I think will make Survarium stand out in the crowd. While the freeplay mode is what seems the most interesting thing to me, the PvP portion is done well and most of the weapons feel really good/impactful. There is plenty of customizations (clothing, weapons, items, and different camos). The best part of the PvP to me is the interesting large maps and the well done gunplay. While I can’t say Survarium is the best game, but if you enjoy competitive FPS games you should check this out. I personally looking forward to the PvE mode and can’t wait for it to be released.
Pros
Tons customization
Cool PvP map layouts
Solid and impactful gunplay
Interesting lore and backstory
Not pay to win
Great Graphics
Skill trees
Huge potential
Cons
Unbalanced weapons
PvE mode seems to be taking forever to come out
No prone
Performance issues (I had problems with windowed mode, but many other players report more problems)
Bad connection issues

Conclusion
Survarium is an online, free to play, FPS game that is only PvP right now. The gunplay is solid and the maps are designed well, but I am looking forward to the PvE portion of the game. It is not pay to win as some people claim, but it does take time to unlock things “naturally” in Survarium. If you are a competitive FPS fan defiantly check this out. As well, keep an eye on Survarium for the PvE portion of the game to release.
Video Review
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=uODOrzUiFLM&feature=youtu.be

-HiPFiRED

In conclusion it's a good game, play it you won't regret.
