reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATE - 6/26/15
Okay, so it has been a few months since my original review, and my opinion about this game has changed substantially. While I can't quite bring myself to NOT recommending it, I struggle to have fun with it at this point in time.

I think that all of my problems can be boiled down to one major issue: There are very few American players! They've recently introduced the option of selecting which server regions you want to look for, which is a major plus. However, I have a hard time finding a game on a North American server.  The later I play in the day, the lower the number of players. This makes sense because I know the developer is Ukrainian, so they are bound to have more of a following closer to home.

Thanks to the lack of closer players, matchmaking is a real issue. I often times get thrown into a match that is filled with higher ranking people. One time, I cut my profile back to 2 so that I could play with a newcomer friend of mine. We got completely destroyed, and when I looked at the stats of the highest ranking player on the other team, he had a LEVEL 9 profile!! Why would anyone want to play a match that is so ridiculously unbalanced?!

Well, like I mentioned, I think the lack of players on my continent is the real cause of my problems at the moment. I would still recommend the game becuase it can be fun, and it is refreshingly different than many of the online FPS on the market. We just need more American players!!

ORIGINAL REVIEW
The maps are my favorite part about this game. They are vibrant and well balanced for a fair fight. Some are more geared towards close-quarter engagements and others are great for the snipers. There are a good number of them, too, so it doesn't feel like you are getting thrown into the same maps over and over,

The spawning scheme can be a blessing and a curse. There are zones at either end of the maps where each team spawns. This makes those areas a hot bed of activity as there is always somebody trying to sneak in for an easy kill. I couldn't tell for sure, but I think there is a short period of time after someone spawns during which they are bullet proof. I spawned in front of an enemy once, and I was able to kill him even though he had pumped a fair amount of metal into me.

There are a fair amount of weapons to unlock and purchase. Some weapons can only be purchased with gold. There is currently a bit of a balance issue with some guns. Particularly, it's not uncommon to take a level 5 AKS-74U against a level 2 Kiparis and lose every time. The AKS-74U has superior damage and penetration, but is no match for the fire rate of the Kiparis

I'm not a fan of the upgrade system. It is very original, but it's also very hard and costly to upgrade weapons with even a few modifications. In order to upgrade a weapon, you have to have a duplicate of that weapon. You then spend in-game money to ATTEMPT to upgrade. There is no gaurantee that you will get it. And, once you have a modification, there is a chance you can lose it with a failed attempt to upgrade again. The more mods you get, the harder it is to succeed at getting more. Furthermore, you have no control over what mod you get. There is a way to attempt to change your mods, but, again, you have to have a spare gun to try it.

There is no incentive to use one gun or another. Maybe I'm used to games like BF and CoD (booo, I know), but I like to earn things for my weapons by using them successfully. As you use a weapon over and over, you get proficient at it. This should be reflected somehow with upgrades, or maybe an increased chance at upgrade success.

Overall, I'm really liking this game, and have lured a handful of friends into liking it as well. There are a few aspects that really irritate me, but for being early access and free, this is off to a great start!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

UPDATE - 6/26/15
Okay, so it has been a few months since my original review, and my opinion about this game has changed substantially. While I can't quite bring myself to NOT recommending it, I struggle to have fun with it at this point in time.

I think that all of my problems can be boiled down to one major issue: There are very few American players! They've recently introduced the option of selecting which server regions you want to look for, which is a major plus. However, I have a hard time finding a game on a North American server.  The later I play in the day, the lower the number of players. This makes sense because I know the developer is Ukrainian, so they are bound to have more of a following closer to home.

Thanks to the lack of closer players, matchmaking is a real issue. I often times get thrown into a match that is filled with higher ranking people. One time, I cut my profile back to 2 so that I could play with a newcomer friend of mine. We got completely destroyed, and when I looked at the stats of the highest ranking player on the other team, he had a LEVEL 9 profile!! Why would anyone want to play a match that is so ridiculously unbalanced?!

Well, like I mentioned, I think the lack of players on my continent is the real cause of my problems at the moment. I would still recommend the game becuase it can be fun, and it is refreshingly different than many of the online FPS on the market. We just need more American players!!

ORIGINAL REVIEW
The maps are my favorite part about this game. They are vibrant and well balanced for a fair fight. Some are more geared towards close-quarter engagements and others are great for the snipers. There are a good number of them, too, so it doesn't feel like you are getting thrown into the same maps over and over,

The spawning scheme can be a blessing and a curse. There are zones at either end of the maps where each team spawns. This makes those areas a hot bed of activity as there is always somebody trying to sneak in for an easy kill. I couldn't tell for sure, but I think there is a short period of time after someone spawns during which they are bullet proof. I spawned in front of an enemy once, and I was able to kill him even though he had pumped a fair amount of metal into me.

There are a fair amount of weapons to unlock and purchase. Some weapons can only be purchased with gold. There is currently a bit of a balance issue with some guns. Particularly, it's not uncommon to take a level 5 AKS-74U against a level 2 Kiparis and lose every time. The AKS-74U has superior damage and penetration, but is no match for the fire rate of the Kiparis

I'm not a fan of the upgrade system. It is very original, but it's also very hard and costly to upgrade weapons with even a few modifications. In order to upgrade a weapon, you have to have a duplicate of that weapon. You then spend in-game money to ATTEMPT to upgrade. There is no gaurantee that you will get it. And, once you have a modification, there is a chance you can lose it with a failed attempt to upgrade again. The more mods you get, the harder it is to succeed at getting more. Furthermore, you have no control over what mod you get. There is a way to attempt to change your mods, but, again, you have to have a spare gun to try it.

There is no incentive to use one gun or another. Maybe I'm used to games like BF and CoD (booo, I know), but I like to earn things for my weapons by using them successfully. As you use a weapon over and over, you get proficient at it. This should be reflected somehow with upgrades, or maybe an increased chance at upgrade success.

Overall, I'm really liking this game, and have lured a handful of friends into liking it as well. There are a few aspects that really irritate me, but for being early access and free, this is off to a great start!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Looking back on my former review and after playing allot of hours here is an update:

+ Balance is still a issue, mainly due to the lower player count it is possible to get matched with low level players. If your new and don't want to be crushed play on peak times.
+ There are quite a few good weapons with decent iron sights, but i still hate it ;p. (HK416 has a red dot, but its glowing so hard you can't see much in dark areas)
+ Zubr armor is still hard to defeat, look at the balance part. It is doable with rank 8 weapons.
+ I see less spawn camping now, mainly due to better players in the ranks i play in. Still happonds if one of the teams hold back too much.

+/- Need premium to level up in a decent way (+50 exp +50 silver +50 faction rep). But since its FreeToPlay... hey the devs need something to eat right?
+/- Community can seem to be rotten, but its simple. You get what you put in it. Whine and act like a ♥♥♥♥♥ and it will come back.

- SVD, i ♥♥♥♥ing hate that thing. Low levels ripping open Molot/Zubr guys like its nothing. Grow balls you lame asses.

Thats it for now :).

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Looks fun, plays quite ok but...

- Terribad balance in ranked games.
- Only extremely high tier weapons come with scopes, so if your bad with ironsights... well good luck...
- AK12 + Tier 15 armor = win (now Tier 10, tiers got changed later from 15 to 10)
- Lots and lots of spawn camping
- Need premium to level up in a decent way (+50 exp +50 silver +50 faction rep)
- Got stupid team mates that run over your traps? Enjoy the teamkill point punishment.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Mechanically this game is an excellent free-to-play FPS. It's RPG Elements were fresh, to me, and it has done well in areas most other free-to-play FPS games have failed, most notably:


- Ranking systems based on level and equipment which make sense, are intuitive and set you up against players of comparable skill level. Although occasionally a player far to good to be in your tier does slip in.
- The visuals are unexpectedly good, the aesthetic of old and new russian weaponry is very pleasing, the post apocolyptic feel is captured well for the most part.
- The controls feel responsive and intuitive, in moments where they don't such things are intentional game mechanical decisions which make sense and contribute to the overall depth and possibly quality of the game (ie. such as where one adds stat points to improve the inefficiency of that kind of movement. Aiming down sight, running, etc.)
- The game generally captures a realistic and punishing FPS feel without being innaccesible to 99% of the planet like DayZ or comparables.
- Manages to only be minimalistically pay-to-win as of 4/6/2016.

Some random neutral things to note about the game:

- Finding a match can be a bit of a wait (2 minute one average for me, a low level player), but completely tolerable and understandable.
- Matches are 8v8, not on the scale you might expect of other FPS games. This often serves to make matches more personal and most of your deaths will be due to skill imbalance and error.
- I've never handled a gun in real life, can't speak to how realistic the firing of guns are in this game but I do know that many of the guns have a helluva lot of recoil so be prepared.

My largest gripes:

- Possibly not highly optimized (coming from the perspective of only my system in 4/6/2016)
- Lack of gender and race diversity.
- (Correct me if I'm wrong, I will be playing more) The skill system seems to force you down one of two main focuses, either building efficiency of gunplay, or focusing on skills to help deal with a game element known as anomolies, glowing balls of energy that hurt you but can be harvested for superhuman powers.

I'll comment more on the race and gender diversity here because I believe things need to be said of it. First off its one that I have with a lot of games. I found Survivarum's lack of race or gender diversity in character creation to be insulting personally, and unnecesary given that video games are essentially a limitless creative medium. More than just cisgender white men are interested in playing your game devs, and we'd like to be able to represent ourselves in your game space. A purely cisgender, white, male cast is not actually a necessary part of the aesthetic you are trying to capture. Nowadays there is enough awareness that there is no excuse for a lack of representation and presentation in video games and yeah I'm entitled to be able to play as someone other than Grizzly McWhiteDude, thanks.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I've played this for a couple of hours now.

Matchmaking gets a bit better as you rank up a bit, same with gear. The game might look pay-to-win at first, but it's incredibly easy to get yourself started gear and an UZI early on, just from a couple of matches I can already afford weapons that are waaaay above my level. If you think this is pay to win, you need to play it some more, because progression in this is much faster than it is in games like War Thunder.

The gunplay is fun, and the weapon classes all feel like they have distinct roles. The community could use some growth, that's for certain. I feel like this game could really take off, especially if the co-op modes are anything like Stalker.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

according to steam i only played  3hrs but i played extensively in the  no steam version, what person levels up to 20 in only 3 hrs...  I'm in a love-hate relationship with this game... But i recommend this game as it has a lot of potential.

+NOT P2W
but srly  this game is not p2w and everyone who says it is either trolling, or is terrible, i went completly f2p and i have 200000 in game currency which is enough to buy the godly guns & armor like the pkp pechneg or the a-545. Don't forget in the upcoming .28 update, the rank in whick u get items will be lowered  and the godly weapons will only require lvl 10 reputation , which is good for me as I am level 10 rep.

+Good Sound design
the game has really good sound design, you can track people by their footsteps & gunshots though the gunshots are extremly loud which is realistic i guess, I'm not really a gun nut so i can't really confirm

+ Good Graphics & Art Style
the graphics are really good and for a alpha/beta is surprisingly well optimized with my rig at max settings at 45-60fps
the art style is also awesome with the world being a post apocalyptic game but still being colorful and pretty and not dull and boring looking while still managing to look broken down & post apoclyptic. The art style makes up for any of the graphical shortcomings

- Spawn campers
trust me if you're going up angainst a good team with a team of random noobs u r going to get spawnrekt by sniper rifles and since their aren't any kill cams... yeaaaa but the snipers aren't op as they have  lots of scope sway unless you crouch but it still is annoying. of course when the teams are balanced it isn't much of an issue which brings me to the next problem

- matchmaking
once you become >19 it takes 5mins to matchmake and often because they can't find a game for you, you get matched up with a bunch of newbs, it can also happen the other way aroun

- bugs
this is a beta but it gets so annoying when basic things like logging on doesn't work and the updater sometimes borks, indeed I currently have a annoying issue where when i try to logon with the steam verson it says connection error even though my internet it fine. while wierd glitches are ok in beta (it is a beta) issues with logging on is never acceptable unless the server is hacked or overloaded.
EDIT: the connection error listed above actually got fixed 2ish days after it happened but i actually waited 2 days so it might have been fixed earlier.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game needs work, I'll say that much. But that's the reason it's in early access, because it needs input from the community as it grows. But as of right now, this game is freaking awesome. While there is a lot of room for imporvement this is probably one of the best free to play games I have played on steam, and I've played a lot of them... The balance between start factions is pretty decent, the mechanics are solid especially compared to other games, and so far the game isn't really heavy on pay to win. While you can buy better guns with irl cash the game puts you in higher level lobbies with players closer to your equpment level and skill level. My biggest personal problem with this game currently is the spawn camping. I haven't seen a single game where there hasn't been one person inside of your spawn killing you as soon as the spawn protection" is down. Although there are things already present in the game that could fix this if the developers had enough input on the subject. For example make each spawn radioactive to the opposite team at a decent range from the spawn and make that radioactivity ignore protective gear as the enemies get closer to the center of spawn. That would outright solve the problem. In spite of its problems though I would highly recomend this game
recommended: hell it doesn't even take that long to download."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

If you don't mind a little bit of grinding, you'll find a unique, tactical fps game. This game has great map design and weapons are very lethal. You are given missions from your faction every day which keep things interesting. My biggest complaint so far is that everything is pretty expensive and there are only a couple guns available at lower levels.
Luckily the matchmaking only puts you in games with people close to your own level, and I never felt like things were unbalanced.
Overall I had a good time and am definitely going to check back soon when anomalies are implemented. I think that dynamic hazardous areas on maps could add a lot to the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A refreshing (although clearly unfinished) work which really emphasizes the value of cover (trees, walls and anything else which will stop a bullet) and concealment (bushes and anything that keeps you from being spotted), movement and teamwork. The bonuses for being near a friendly player who makes a kill and benefiting from his kill when you have done some damage to the same target are good.

Weather and environmental effects such as sunlight, radioactive areas and areas with poisonous gases make for some unusual barriers as well as an interesting influence on play style. You learn quickly for example, that it is better to shoot out of the sun than into it, higher up is better but not always best and you cannot run through contaminated areas without the proper equipment and survive.

The fact that you can spawn just about anywhere at the later stages of a round keep the spawn campers to a minimum but there is still a lot of spawn killing.

Since it is a beta version I assume that the complete lack of penalties for team killing will be added once they decide what is appropriate. The crazies take advantage of this fact sometimes and can really ruin a match if not dealt with.

That was my 2 cents worth ;)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

With games like Blacklight and Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Phantoms
you tend to have an issue where balance is a major problem, pay to win isn't necessarily true.

With this game, you have a well balanced game. getting out of the training wheels, doesn't end up making
you regret picking it up. There's an actual level of difficult that slowly increases over time.

It's fun, balanced, has a great system for if you get disconnected. The fights are tense, and the gun sounds
are just amazing. The only complaint" is the amount of crashes it has due to being beta.

I am COMPLETELY looking forward to the Free Roam update to come out.

This is truly our STALKER 2"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

pros:

Has leveling system, when you play you get xp and level up, you can then choose perks to get a little buffs in some areas, like less recoil, faster aiming, faster running and so on.

has crafting and gear system, you can buy gear like pants, shoes, gloves, helmets, backpacks, chest armor and guns, then you can upgrade them all, has a crafting system which lets you add mods to your gear which increase some stats, like 5% faster running, 10% faster reload, more armor and so on.

has a very unique anomaly system, on the maps there are anomalies which deal different type of damage and you need protection against it, in those anomalies there are artifacts which you can pick up and use if you have equipment, those artifacts are very strong stuff and give you both passive and active bonuses, for instance 1 of the artifacts is onyx it blocks 10% of damage as a passive bonus and if you active it it blocks 50% damage for around 5 seconds, you can have up to 4 artifacts at the same time and you can stack them.

maps are very very beautiful, they are done very good, graphics are pretty good.

there is no P2W, things you can buy are stuff that lets you farm faster and some visuals, like camo which you can use on gear and change its color.

realistic shooting system, guns are pretty accurate, they have recoil, they have some dispersion, its a very skill-based game. also gun sounds are amazing, very realistic. infact as far as i know they actually shot all those guns and recorded the sounds to put it in game.

cons:

developers are rather slow, patches come every few months and they are not very huge.

game still has some desync issues, even tho it was a problem over a year, it is getting fixed every patch but its still not completely fixed.

its still early access so a lot of stuff is not in the game, there will be bugs, crashes and so on. just whatever you would expect from early access.


to sum it up, this is a great game, definitely worth checking out, its completely free to play, you can get everything without paying a single cent and it has some very unique features. totally worth checking out.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Played a couple matches until I ranked up to level 5. The game feels like some sort of mix between Red Orchestra and Insurgency, and the general atmosphere is amazing and the kind I do not often see.

Pros:
-Very high quality sounds. You can hear footsteps from the floor above you as enemies and friendlies rush around, The sound of the weapons firing is also amazing and truly has you immersed in the combat.
-Glorious environment. The overgrowth in the maps truly sets the post-apocalyptic tone very well, and not only does it make the maps appear absolutely amazing, but the foliage actually provides good hiding spots.
-Free to Play guns are good enough to give you a fighting chance.
-Customisation is present even without spending money, albeit with ranked restrictions. You wanna look suave? Gotta work for it.
-Realistic damage model, to an extent. If you get hit at all, chances are you're dead, bleeding out (then dying), or half dead. If you hit a guy in the face, they're dead, if you hit them in the leg, they'll slow dramatically. Powerful weapons like the mosin 'starter weapon' can kill anyone with one shot, their drawback being their bolt action mechanism.
-It's just a generally beautiful game.

Cons:
-P2W is present. Despite my earlier point, players can very easily buy the premium currency and buy considerably better weapons with it, making it much more difficult for people playing with standard in game currency.
-Low recoil (could be considered a benefit, to be honest) makes long range SMG shooting relatively easy.
-FPS dips in some points. Granted, I do not have a very good processor so that may be down to my own lack of power.
-Team killing is awful. For whatever reason, people decide they're master trolls and shoot anyone in their own team, making your own score much worse than it could be, and if you retaliate you also lose points. There's no way to stop team killers.

I definitely recommend this game.
voteText: 3 of 5 people (60%) found this review helpful

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nI was stuck in this game for several hours after launching it. After I finally lanched it, I mean. reviewText:
Early Access Review

I have put a lot of hours into this game, and I can say that it is really fun. I have had the best time playing with my friends and just messing around while we try to win the game. The graphics are really good, the guns feel more balanced thanks to the new update (32.a). I love the way the armor looks, in all factions. I personally play as the Renisance Army because I like to be a tank, my friend plays as the Scavengers, and we both have found a lot of joy playing in those factions. The new update seems to have fixed almost all of my grevences with the game, the only thing I can say now is I get insane FPS drops on some servers, I have a really good computer and max this game out with ease and my internet is really stable. I don't know for sure what is causing this, but it doesn't happen TOO often. I have not yet gotten to play around with the league matches, as I am not a high enough rank (I've had to put a lot of time in lower level matches to help out a friend so I got less reputation for those games). If you are on the fence about getting this game, don't be! IT'S FREE! And the best free to paly I have played.

Pros-
-Quite decent amount of guns
-Decent amount of armor
-The factions are diverce enough for varrying playstyles
-Graphics are really beautiful
-Sound design is really good
-Ballance issues fixed for the most part
-The anomally mechanic is really cool
-The modifier mechanic will let you personalize your gun
-Decent amount of maps
-The maps are of really high quallity
-You can unlock almost everything without pay-for currency (and what you can is the EXACT samething with a different skin and the modifiers pre-installed)
-Daily quest are fun
-The RPG elements add a lot to the game and let you further personalize your playstyle

Cons-
-Sever conection issues (might just be me?)
-Matchmaking times (it sometimes takes 7 mins, and sometimes 1)
-Sometimes you get a rank 6-7 in a pridomantly rank 5 match, with a few rnak 4's thrown in non-peak hours which can make it really frusterating to be those lower ranks (and a lot of fun for the rank 6 and 7's) <-- can be fixed with more players.
-There is a glitch were if one of your squadmates is wearing a certain mask, the glass of the mask thinks it is joined to your face, this only happens in the lobby with your squad, or post match with your team. This is less of a con, and more of a glitch that is funny as hell.

I can proudly say that I recommend this game, I have gotten my friend and my brother to play it a lot, and as soon as my other friends get computer that aren't as old as sliced bread, they will join in on the fun.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I wanted to love this game, but I hate it.  Lets start from the begining...

When I first heard about this game it was couple years ago, when they initialy announced that they will release an MMO Shooter*(oh yeah) in stalker universe, everything looked soo good and promising I quickly managed to hop onto CAT and later CBT and OBT now on steam... I liked the gun handling and everything before they widened amount of people on servers... they just got overwhelmed by russian cheaters and exploiters wich is a shame, what changed for the worse is the progression system and the general UI that got consolified ?......

If they ever manage to repair this game add meaningfull PVE/PVP*(I really think that those grotesque arenas that they have right now are doing more harm then good to the player base) content that isn't full of cheaters and exploiters, I'll give it another try, but for now it's another failed S.T.A.L.K.E.R'esk game that doesnt even touch small toe of what they have promised when they announced.

On the last note lets hope and pray that they manage to still make something great out of this game in the future, and they don't make it another cashcow game that is neither bad, neither good...

For now steer away from it and come back in couple months.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

After having played some matching I can say this game is OK. It's fun to play with a friend and playing alone is also pretty fun. The game feels cool and adrenaline really starts pumping when you are in a 1V1 sniper battle or corner battle. Also the graphics are great! Although it looks fun there are some glitches and bugs that ruin the game completely. For instance getting stuck in a corner or under a prop. This can get annoying fairly quickly. Also... Shotguns are too OP. They damage you immensly on long ranges. They pretty much are the snipers of the game and I really think the devs should change this as quickly as possible as it annoys the crap out of me and many others.
But because it is a free game, give it a chance. I also hope the game will soon get out of BETA with better mechanics and some general improvements. I don't really know if I should give this game a tumbs down or up but with the current problems I can better give this game a tumbs down and reconsider it after the BETA has stopped and the final game releases.
I still recommend you download this game and try it as it is free... but don't expect much :D
(And yes, this may sound hypocrite... I'm just not really sure what I think of this game yet)

reviewText:
PLEASE DO NOT LOOK AT MY PLAY TIME, IT IS STEAM ONLY

I have BOUGHT this FREE TO PLAY game when i first had the chance and i never thought back about my decision. I love this game, i've spent over a hundred hours playing, and as I've said earlier, I even bought a free to play game.

They had those Founder Packs which basically gave you the option to play Closed Beta (of course they paid you back with Gold Ingame equivalent to the amount of money you gave)

Also about buying Gold ingame, It is not a Pay 2 Win, Gold is mostly used for either buying Gear Early or buying things like Emblems, flags, camos etc.

A very good point in this game which i have never seen anywhere in a free to play. Don't shoot anywhere you want since You have to buy your own ammo for every gun!
YES, You pay for every single bullet you waste messing around.

All i can do is recommend this game for you, although My opinion could be a bit biased since i am a Big S.T.A.L.K.E.R serries fan and I could not wait for this game to release.

Thanks for Reading, Peace

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Fun to play and very gorgeous game. Gameplay is a mix of online PVP game types and is pretty standard. What really shines is the amazing graphics and very simple but polished movement and gunning. Maps usually have cramped tight spaces and wide open areas. The guns all have long range and high damage that makes engagements short and tense at close range, at long range the environment allows for a lot of use of cover and concealment and feels like a more tactical game.

The currency system seems expense for real money investments, but I've been getting free currency after every match at a pretty good rate. There some items that are paid currency only, but there are a bunch of free currency items that you can buy. The guns are all so high damage that I doubt that any paid guns or armor could be better" than the free ones. So that's nice.

TLDR:Awesome online PVP shooter

reviewText:
Early Access Review

A very good and promising game idea from the creators of the S.T.A.L.K.E.R series turned into a fairly generic run-of-the mill CS style arena team shooter.

It's not a bad game and has some great features. The gun play, weapons handling and graphics are superb for a F2P game. The weapons feel older, more realistic than in some other shooters and it really compliments the atmosphere and setting of the game. You feel like you're using salvaged guns from the post apocalyptic wastes.

However, unlike a lot of the serious competitive multi-player shooters available today Survarium does have problems in the sound department. While the guns are lound, crisp and realistic...the game has virtually no way of telling what direction a shot came from beynd the two standard soundings of close and far away.
Enemy footsteps are also seemingly missing too. For any serious player these are essentials of any good shooter. Survarium will leave these players wanting.

The model does have the potential to be P2W, but as it stands right now it didn't feel that the enemies had any advantage on me for not paying and many of the free guns I used felt powerful enough to not need to dump real world money on gold" guns.

Team kill can be an issue
date:
however I only suffered this in one game out of arounf fifteen.

Graphics 7/10
Sound 5/10
Gameplay 7/10
Story N/A
Originality 5/10
Value/replayability 8/10

Overall Score 7/10
"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I fully recomend trying this game, it's free to play, so you're not missing out on any money if you decide it's not for you.

I wanted to put in at least 100hrs into this game as reading the negative reviews and seeing only 0.9hrs played etc. I feel that some really haven't given it a chance.

First thing you need to know, it's in BETA, so if you're looking for a completed game with no bugs this is not it...YET! However if you're willing to stick with it and give feedback to the Devs then this might be for you.

Yes there are some bugs and there has been problems with the NA servers (not sure if they're sorted now, as we now have the 0.28 update as of today).

The positive
+Really fun shooter
+Cool customization
+Nice character leveling system
+Has enough scope to cater for most playstyles
+Guns feel realistic (as of update 0.28)
+Gun upgrading is a nice idea
+Level designs are good
+Active Devs
+Random Anomalies (changes the way you move around the map, depending on gear)
+Matchmaking is based on equipment level rather than character level

The Negative
-Spawn Campers
-Trolls (unfortunatly you can't stop them, however Devs will ban if you report them and they are deemed worthy of banning)
-Matchmaking (has been a problem, putting lvl 5 equipment up against lvl 15, however the new update should change this)

One of the big deals with this game is that people think it's Pay to Win, I have to dissagree. There are premium weapons and they can give a slight advantage (maybe 10%) the majority of stuff that you can buy with real money is aesphetics such as a flag to put on you're top or bottoms.
With reguards to a premium weapon, yes it is fully upgraded with 3 modifications, however you cannot change these mods, so generally they only have 2 that improve the weapon and the 3rd that allows more income. When you upgrade weapons from scratch it's possible to have 3 upgrades that benifit the weapon.

I should explain that mods are random you use one weapon to upgrade another of the same type (e.g. you upgrade a Mosin with a Mosin). There is a risk when upgrading, if you use in game currency, there is a chance of failing and if you're upgrading a weapon that's aready upgraded there is a chance of losing a modification.

Hopefully this review has sparked some interest and I'll see you on the battlefield.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I fully recomend trying this game, it's free to play, so you're not missing out on any money if you decide it's not for you.

I wanted to put in at least 100hrs into this game as reading the negative reviews and seeing only 0.9hrs played etc. I feel that some really haven't given it a chance.

First thing you need to know, it's in BETA, so if you're looking for a completed game with no bugs this is not it...YET! However if you're willing to stick with it and give feedback to the Devs then this might be for you.

Yes there are some bugs and there has been problems with the NA servers (not sure if they're sorted now, as we now have the 0.28 update as of today).

The positive
+Really fun shooter
+Cool customization
+Nice character leveling system
+Has enough scope to cater for most playstyles
+Guns feel realistic (as of update 0.28)
+Gun upgrading is a nice idea
+Level designs are good
+Active Devs
+Random Anomalies (changes the way you move around the map, depending on gear)
+Matchmaking is based on equipment level rather than character level

The Negative
-Spawn Campers
-Trolls (unfortunatly you can't stop them, however Devs will ban if you report them and they are deemed worthy of banning)
-Matchmaking (has been a problem, putting lvl 5 equipment up against lvl 15, however the new update should change this)

One of the big deals with this game is that people think it's Pay to Win, I have to dissagree. There are premium weapons and they can give a slight advantage (maybe 10%) the majority of stuff that you can buy with real money is aesphetics such as a flag to put on you're top or bottoms.
With reguards to a premium weapon, yes it is fully upgraded with 3 modifications, however you cannot change these mods, so generally they only have 2 that improve the weapon and the 3rd that allows more income. When you upgrade weapons from scratch it's possible to have 3 upgrades that benifit the weapon.

I should explain that mods are random you use one weapon to upgrade another of the same type (e.g. you upgrade a Mosin with a Mosin). There is a risk when upgrading, if you use in game currency, there is a chance of failing and if you're upgrading a weapon that's aready upgraded there is a chance of losing a modification.

Hopefully this review has sparked some interest and I'll see you on the battlefield.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Basically, this game is like World of Tanks and  S.T.A.L.K.E.R combined.
If you love radiation and Chernobyl-style maps, then you will fall in love with this game.

PROS:
- Beautiful graphics
- Lots of customizations
- Free 2 Play
- It's not Pay to Win - if somebody tells you it is P2W, he lies
- Beautiful nature and atmoshpere
- Huge maps

CONS:
- Most of your team is always AFK
- Shotguns OP
- Low-end PCs will suffer from very low FPS
- Slow in-game progress of your character


The developers also promised to add PvE and free roam.
Personally, I don't understand why this game gets so much hate. It is freaking awesome!

reviewText:
I've been excited about Survarium for a long time coming! Great to see that it's found its way on to Steam.

While still in Beta, the core gameplay is solid, and the maps are beaufitul.

The equipment loadout system and the matchmaking system still need polish. But the game is fun, and I'm looking forward to trying new modes as they are added.

The maps are beautiful, too. I've never seen such detail in PvP. It really looks and feels like the STALKER universe. Realistic movement speeds and crappy weapons in beautiful maps. Love it.

I'm looking forward especially to the PvE mode that's coming. This is a promising start.

reviewText: There is one man left on the planet. A russian scientist, who, before the world ending cataclysm, set up a cloning project that would soon doom the world. When the ashes cleared it was discovered that the cloning facility had been pumping copies of the scientist into the world. His clones rose up and repopulated, but only in the absoulte worst possible places. They grew strong. Too strong. They began to splinter. They created factions that innevitably went to war over the giant ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s that had arisen in the landscape during the cataclysm. reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nPretty Solid for being Early Access. A few bugs, but mostly just balance and quality of life stuff like having to hold ADS. Movement is a little clunky, but weapons are smooth and sound great! The MMO aspects of character customization are a nice touch and seem to have good depth to set players apart from each other eventually. Game is NOT P2W since nearly everything can be purchased with earned in-game currency. Maps and graphics are as pretty and atmospheric as you would expect from a STALKER game. Graphics could use some optimizing, but that's expected. Overall, it feels way better than any of the latest Zombie crap shoot games built on the Arma mod. The guns and slightly slower gamplay will remind some of the original COD I think. I see great things from Survivarium as long as they keep working hard on it from here. It's F2P so try it for yourself.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

This game is currently Early Access, but I'd already buy it to be able to play it from time to time,
because everything I need from it is working good enough.

But that is not necessary, because the game is free to play.
I like the game very much but currently I see no point in buying something in the shop, there is nothing of interest to me.
Armor, Weapons, I just buy them ingame. More XP? What for? I play the game because ... you know .. I want to play it.
No need to rush.

So what is this game?

It is a shooter. The weapons have iron sights and behave more like Americas Army than like Call of Duty. What means, there IS some running and shooting, but mostly it is crouching, searching for an enemy and hoping for a one hit one kill shot.
A lot of tension is building, when you know, there has to be an enemy in that area, but you just can't see him.
Then you see him.
You circle a bit around to come at him from his side.
You aim for him and buff... you are dead. You did not see the other one coming.

The graphics are great, I really like them, the sounds are good the game is good.
I get crashes from time to , say.. every 3 hours or so. But it is worth it.

After 20 hours gameplay I just got my first sniper rifle with scope. A scope! I'll rule the world.
Only bad thing is, I will be machted into games with other guys who just got... you saw this coming: their first sniper rifle with scope.
Or their new shiny sub machine gun or what ever they get in their chosen faction.

This game is a slow shooter with good graphics and 100% fun.

Early Access Review

Didn't log too much time into this game before I was able to lay judgement. The game at its present point is riddled with hackers and game breaking graphical issues. Apart from that, the movement is okay, the weapons are decent, the UI rivals the tediousness of games like War Thunder, but is managable. I wouldn't suggest getting into this one until the devs crack down on getting hackers out, and hopefully implement an anti-cheat system.

The sounds in the game are great. Footsteps, hall reverb, water drops in caves, thunder, rain, etc. The sound is fantastic. You can feel the bass from the thunder as if you were there. But it just doesn't make up for the rest. Play at your own risk.

reviewText:
Product received for free

Early Access Review

It's a great FPS for players on a low budget. I have not paid anything yet, but in comparison to other games the fun level is even higher. People who only find negative aspects are single-minded, really. There are some balance issues with weapons for example, but none that would completely crash your experience. Servers are stable, graphics nice. I'll continue this in a list.

+well-made graphics
+realistic sound
+realistic feeling overall
+RPG elements!
+GUNS!, in a decent amount and variety
+traps, in case you feel cheeky
+you can import your CSGO aim
+ the developers DO care. who ever said something different just does not care himself. the amount of updates stays decent, so do content and changes

- minor balancing issues, but you may look past these after all
- minor exploitation of overpowered camping spots, yet you may outdo such players as well

And now call me a fanboy for I have picked more pros than cons, but I try to look at the game as realistic as possible. It is not pay to win in any way either, as bought guns do not have any advantage to them besides earning you more silver (and maybe exp). Kids that buy a high tier gun will find themselves defenseless if they don't know how to use the gun too.

RECOMMENDED, indeed.

reviewText:
Survarium.

Is this title just another first person shooter [FPS] with massively multiplayer online roleplaying game [MMORPG] and post apocalyptic survival elements? Well... yeah...? That's kind of what Vostok Games was aiming for.

There isn't much to offer as far as the story. Actually, there isn't any kind of story whatsoever, but what is promised to come will definitely keep me waiting and kicking ♥♥♥ with a decent sized community in match making.

There are 3 game types [2 of which you have to unlock], 4 visible factions that offer different weapons and armor depending on which one you join [each faction can be ranked up which unlocks higher level weapons and armor], a clan system and several other intriguing features.

Now, here's where I want everyone reading this to pay close attention to:

The gaming world is cluttered with several free to play [F2P] and pay to play [P2P] titles. I would have to say that ALL of them have some sort of in-game shop/vendor/currency that you're able to spend real money to have an advantage in some way, shape or form. It's not required. Hell, it's not even necessary to enjoy most games.

As I've spent the last several hours playing Survarium, reaching level 6 and rank 3 in my faction, I've noticed several reviews, the in-game community and those that haven't even tried the game say that it's pay to win [P2W]. This isn't even remotely true. Most of the people that throw the word pay to win around either hate the developer, had a bad experience or just suck at it.

I haven't spent a dime on this game and I'm enjoying every second of it and it's not even 1/4 of the way developed. It's still in the beta phase! There's so many interesting updates to come and hopefully a fun, healthy and helpful community that comes along with them.

I'm anxious for the future of Survarium, I most definitely give it a thumbs up and recomend everyone that's worried about the mixed reviews to give it a shot!

Thanks for reading. :]

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The store page will state that this is an Early Access game, the developers will say that it is in a beta stage, but none of that is really true. This game features a real-money store, therefore it's as launched as it ever will be. On that note, to obtain all four currently released DLC packs, you have pay nearly 150 EUR. The in-game store is also overpriced.

You might have heard that this game will eventually have an open world PvE/PvP area. From what I've found, it was supposed to be out years ago and now has been delayed even further, with no official response as to when it might be released. If you're coming here because of that, don't bother waiting. It might as well be vaporware at this point.

As for the game itself:

What do you get when you mix overpromising with slow development? Survarium, apparently. This is a good-looking game, no one can deny that, but when it comes to gameplay, it just falls down face flat. Under the pretty coat of paint is a generic FPS game that pretends to be something more.

Pros:

- The artstyle is nice.

Cons:

- Clunky controls. Imagine that you're controlling someone in an armour made of cardboard boxes.
- You might read in-game that camouflaging your outfit is a good idea to stay hidden. It's pointless. The killcam will give away your position anyway.
- The realistic" body damage doesn't go far enough. Equip a bandage and it might as well not exist.
- Spawnkilling. If the enemy team is too strong
date: they will push you back to your base and kill you the second you spawn. There is not a single way to fight this."

reviewText:
Okay, I knew something was up when I went to download the game and it was a reletively short download. Actually, I lied. The mostly negetive reviews really clued me in. But ignoring that, the download time was suspicious. I go to launch the game and it boots up an installer. Alright, kind of counter intutive I think but as long as it eventually gets me to the game I think. Wrong. The installer immediately has a bigger fit than an epiliptic overweight mentally handicapped 7 year old child in a candy shop, spamming me with error box after error box. Well, ♥♥♥♥. I uninstall the game and reinstall it. I try to launch it again. The executible is missing now. So after redownloading I had to verify the cache, find out everything was missing, and have to redownload a THIRD time. It's kind of getting old but I'm a fan of the STALKER franchise so I decide to go for the long haul.

Turns out, third time's the charm. The download finished, and the installer successfully installed the launcher. After a handful of small patches I got to launch the game. Alright, finally getting to the action I think. The game boots up and I'm not sure if it's because I'm hung over or the game is actually so atrocious that it made me nausious and gave me a headache. It's not nesicarially that it's graphically bad but it's just so obviously a reskinned Alliance Of Valiant Arms. It's AVA with a STALKER franchise slapped on top. That's it. The UI is also reminiscent of a high-speed 2009 F2P flash game like Evony or its many knockoffs.

I managed to not projectile vomit, and decided to try to actually get in game before really sealing the deal on my opinion. I noticed there was a dumb tutorial with a small reward for completion, but you get no reward for skipping the tutorial, which is kind of ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t in my opinion. If you skip it you should get the reward either way, sorry for not being a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ and needing you to hold my hands to learn a genre I've been playing since 1995, developers. Because I'm a cheap ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ though I decide to go along with the tutorial for the reward. I gave my AVAclone character a mosin nagant and launched PVP match making.

Then I waited. And I got hooked up with other players. Then I waited. And waited some more. And waited even longer. Apparently there's not enough servers for this game, they didn't expect so many people to try and play this peice of garbage. 10 minutes later I decide I've had quite enough waiting and I go to exit the game. Except the exit button doesn't work. The developers are literally so incompitent they can't code the exit button correctly. Quality. That's alright though because ctrl+alt+del-ing and forcing the process to end was honestly more satisfying.

Overall I'd rate the game 9/11, good nausia and waiting simulator. Kind of felt like being in the part of the hospital where there's a lot of sick and dieing people, lots of open and infected wounds. Imagine that smell of sterile cleaning products and musky, damp bloody and pus-y injuries hitting your nose at the same time. Glorious.
voteText: 30 of 59 people (51%) found this review helpful 8 people found this review funny

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Survarium was definitely one of those rare games you just happen to stumble upon.  I have thoroughly enjoyed every minute of playing it and I am very glad to have found it.  The atmosphere and sounds are just phenomenal and it really gives it that Post-Apocalyptic Russia vibe.  This is not a run and gun type game, instead it rewards you for using caution, whether it be patiently waiting to ambush enemy players or sneak throughout the map remaining undetected picking off stragglers.  It caters to a lot of different play styles and allows you to take different approaches in the said play style.

The only downside is that it is a Beta game. There are bugs and glitches, but that goes to say for most games anyways.  The developers are dedicated and listen to the community.

So overall, I would have to give Survarium a 8.5~9/10 based on current circumstances.  It is definitely worth your time.  It takes a little patience starting out (learning different mechanics of the game) but in the end it is rewarding.

Hello guys,

I just went trough tons of reviews, and I couldn't help but notice that lot of them was full of hate, far too often mentioning the Pay2Win" factor. Shortly

recommended: I've seen gameplay trough all tiers of gear

voteText:
these are the few points I want to highlight and explain to new members of community.

#1 - Pay to win

Like i wrote above
helpfulPercent: lot of people mention this factor as main problem of the game. Truth is
votesHelpful: there is possibility of buying items with premium currency. Those items come with unique stats and look
votesTotal:
but i never found them extremely overpowered since A) almost none of those guns and equipment is effective in higher tier matches and B) even on equal tier u can still get similar or better equipment by regular mechanics.

#2 - Slow development (upcoming free world mode)

This is second hot topic
votesFunny: from which Survarium gets lot of bad reputation. Lot of players who stick with game for a longer time

column16: are angry with how slow progress on game development is. I must agree that it was a bit slow earlier

column19: lot of people turned their backs on VG. Today I think
column20:
VG are more responsible and they do their job in the way they present it to community. From this i assume that the progress will be faster in future and fans of Survarium will get what they are looking for.

#3 - Matchmaking balance

This is I think the biggest problem of all. Lot of players experience matching with people with lot more skill and are frustrated when getting quickscoped in environment they barely know. Development is aware of this and even upcoming patch (0.28) will adjust matchmaking to be more fair to newcomers.

reviewText:
It's like call of duty 3 without any vehicles, so, theres that.

The game is pretty atmosphereic and pretty so you can have some really cool situations, here let me give you an example.

I was crouching through the grass looking for anyone to pew pew at when, as I was crossing the grass in front of a two story building, I saw a shadow on the ground move. To find the source, I looked up and in the direction of the sun to find that there possibly was a person on the roof, and when I finally snuck my way all the way up there, what do you know, some doof was up there; he was swifty gunned down of course, but having found this person not through sound, but entirely by the fact that I saw his shadow for a second, was very satisfying.

As unfinished games go, I actually enjoyed it, It has tight controls and feels more or less fleshed out, but at this point in time I would not reccomend this game soley because it feels very generic, unfinished and unoriginal at the moment.

I DO however reccomend following the game to see where it goes, whenever progress is made.

Bottom line, this game has serious potential and i'm excited to see where that goes.

reviewText:
Right yes I have barely anytime on this game but heres my verdict anyway:

I got into the game and went through the starting bits into my first game, bit clunky but never mind. I got into the game and first noticed the amazing environment. The game looks amazing, apart from arma 3 this is the best game looking game I have ever played, although it requires a hell of a pc to run it. Mine is on ultra and runs at 70fps but I have quite a large pc, so the devs really need to apply optimization for older pcs.
The gameplay is solid. The guns feel good, I especially like the sounds which sound very real life. Also if you get shot then you do eventually bleed out so the game's realistic in that sense.
Now for me I found it hard to level up so I don't know but easier level ups? Because I've looked in the shop and there's very cool looking guns but they are all very high levels.
Customisation. Theres a hell load of funs from sniper rifles to shotguns, to rifles to smgs and each faction has a few going for it. This is all well and good until you find out that all the really cool looking guns are premium and cost gold. *Sad Face*.
Finally modes. At the moment there's only team deathmatch. I feel this is only a test environment as you only get to run around a rather small map and shoot other players-standard fps right? Well according to the devs there are going to be pve worlds in the future like dayz or h1z1 which sounds really cool because the game's realistic and the sounds are life like, etc. The only problem is that we don't know the release date for that. After reading the comments and reviews I can see that the devs promised this years ago and it hasn't come out yet. In general updates are slow so thats that.
Now I hope this helps, I would recommend to try it out because it's quite fun but I wouldn't say to invest in it until the future.
Thanks for reading!

reviewText:
There's something to be had for shooter fans from all different walks. Whether you're playing for the sake of chasing the carrot on the stick (which is really an exaggeration, more on that later), competitive gameplay, or coming along to sight see/explore (it's awfully pretty at times) and experience the inevitable PVE content that has been promised and with the currently designed levels could be easily implemented - It's all here (or soon to be)!

Gunplay is tight and efficient, reminiscent of fast paced shooters such as Call of Duty. You get a small handful of weapons to play with based on what you're interested in, a couple of loadouts, and off you go. The biggest customization in this game comes from equipping different sets of gear and decals/materials to them - and there's plenty. You're given ample resources to spend on purchasing new equipment, and almost as fast as your character levels up, so does your faction rankings and bank account. For every new tier of gear you unlock, starting off with only a few matches to do so, it only takes an hour or two at most to reach the next tier - and you have more than enough money if you were careful with it (and performed well) to buy out the entire set of upgraded stuff.

The world is very well designed, and you'll notice right away just how lush and alive the landscape feels. It's got an otherworldly vibe, but is oddly familiar at the same time. Past the impressive visuals and atmosphere that the game creates, the levels are designed in such a way that clever tactics and exploration are encouraged. Anomalies at various locations add a nice twist, with my personal favorite being the moving electric anomaly on the Vostok Array map, and if you lose track of what you're doing you'd quite quickly mistake yourself to be playing STALKER again. If you've got the gear to resist anomalies, new pathways are opened up for you. If you've got the time and patience to explore the outer reaches of the maps, or explore every nook and cranny, you'll have plenty of alternative routes to take and skirt around the conflict in search of a better vantage point. On top of all that, there's artifacts which can be found in anomalies to give your team temporary bonuses per map - and can be activated for further effects. The artifact gathering aspect is promised to be fleshed out later, so let's see how that goes in the mean time.

As far as free to play is concerned, I'd hardly know. You make so much money while playing that by the time you reach your next tier within your faction, you'll be able to buy everything - and faction advancement is quick and easy. In about 6 hours of playing I managed to make it all the way to the second highest faction rank, and was having fun the entire way through. Might slow down a bit later, but not by much from what I've experienced thus far.

Game balance as it stands could use some work, with SMG's being very powerful in comparison with other weapons (I'd argue they could use their effective range toned down, along with less accuracy to boot) it's a bit of an SMG spraydown in some matches, but most maps have enough sections with large distances between you and your foe that rifles come to shine in their own right. Shotguns are a very destructive although rather hit and miss type ordeal until you're able to get something that holds more than two shots, and even then you'd better hug some corners because short range is the definite, absolute name of their game. The sawed off side arm which can replace your standard pistol is an absolute blast however, and makes clean up or close quarter battles a breeze when you blow them away with a double tap and lighting fast reload.

All in all, I like this game. It's solid for what it is, and seeing as there are plenty of changes and new content yet to come - it's something that if it continues to impress me as such I might consider investing some money into. Vostok is doing a pretty good job with what is the spiritual successor to STALKER as far as I'm concerned.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThis game is really fun, no doubt about it. Sure the people who just buy weapons (yes you can buy guns for actual money) can be annoying, but the game is well balanced and very fun to play, with intersting gun mechanics, variety and character customization, the game is very intersting, and I alredy have 16 hours played on it. Bugs are minor, and the maps are very detailed and uniques, as well as an emphasis on good looking textures. Development has been slow, but the gmae is totally worth it, it is free after all. As well as being very fun to play with friends. (Only 3 of you can be in a squad at a time but if you have a high ranked friend you may want to wait and get a little more ranked up as these players will have better armour and guns than you) Over all a great game. 9/10, will play again!

Early Access Review

I think this game is amazing, the gameplay is fun, there isn't any micspam from 12 year old kids and there isn't anyone moaning about weapons/camping/strats.

The maps are well built, doesn't seem to be any bug spots or glitches in-game.

However loading maps, or generally just running the game seems to crash every 20-30 minutes and it is EXTREMELY frustrating. Maybe if these crash bugs can be sorted out then the game would be superb.

But for now if you're looking for a game that includes survival tactics and intense gameplay then look somewhere else because a lot of the bugs just stop you from being able to play the game.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Where to start, where to start...

I'll start on a good note - this game has potential, especially for fans of the STALKER games or Roadside Picnic, unfortunately...

- The maps are usually beautiful, but horribly designed, most of which have one spawn being camped.
- It's not open world, but rather falls on a Call of Duty style gameplay, with a World of Tanks like interface.
-The gunplay is horrible, with clunky aiming and shots not going at all where your crosshair is.
-Clunky movement, it's hard to get good spots when you ghost through some obsticles or magically jump over others.
- General gameplay is terrible, leather helmets could stop a SVD round, and wool sweaters can stop a .357 magnum.

All that being said, I can't pull myself to exactly hate this game. I keep reminding myself that it's in beta, but on the flip side of the coin, half of the issues won't be fixed. It's also extremely difficult to level up, as around tier 3 you begin running into level 50s in groups who use the generally broken SMGs stumping your leveling process.

This is all coming from a player who wants a good STALKER-like game, but they've taken the core survival nature of STALKER and combined it with Call of Duty. Although the game has a great community, I just don't believe it's something to get excited about.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Bug infested game. As part of the tutorial, the game asked me to play a match to get used to the game...Only to disconnect me from said match, continue the tutorial and...Out of the wazoo, put me back on the exact same match I was kicked out before. This happened 5 or 6 times until the match ended.

As for how the game looks...It seems too simple to use so much processing power in fairly powerful machines. Also, good luck with support on the official forums. People are aggressive, including mods, which leaves you wondering if a kick in the balls wouldn't be a better alternative.

As for gameplay...Due to constant lag and FPS drops, hitting anyone is a matter of PURE LUCK, unless you're plugged straight into their servers. And even with that, you may still miss due to FPS drops.

Not changing the review until the thing is at least playable.

All that being said, I can't pull myself to exactly hate this game. I keep reminding myself that it's in beta, but on the flip side of the coin, half of the issues won't be fixed. It's also extremely difficult to level up, as around tier 3 you begin running into level 50s in groups who use the generally broken SMGs stumping your leveling process.

This is all coming from a player who wants a good STALKER-like game, but they've taken the core survival nature of STALKER and combined it with Call of Duty. Although the game has a great community, I just don't believe it's something to get excited about.

Bug infested game. As for how the game looks...It seems too simple to use so much processing power in fairly powerful machines. Also, good luck with support on the official forums. People are aggressive, including mods, which leaves you wondering if a kick in the balls wouldn't be a better alternative.

As for gameplay...Due to constant lag and FPS drops, hitting anyone is a matter of PURE LUCK, unless you're plugged straight into their servers. And even with that, you may still miss due to FPS drops.

Not changing the review until the thing is at least playable.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is very fun but needs a lot of work on polishing. There's missing game modes and that is reflected in the early access tag on the store page.

Now that's out of the way I'd like to say that I'm really enjoying the game. As an avid STALKER fan I was happy to see the universe taken in a new direction. It might not be a direct link to the series but it definitely has that feel to it. The only mode available now is the PVP mode which is enjoyable but does come with it's downsides, for example hackers. The game has a pay model similar to War Thunder, which most people may see as pay to win but does also come with a nerf of sorts in which all weapons that aren't the default starting weapons require you to buy ammo for them and repair them when they need it.

Overall I like the game a lot but it does need a lot of polishing before it could be considered feature complete.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

***[Review as of 0.29]***

Fantastic FPS with great devs.

many people are turned off by the price of the DLC packs however, This game is NOT pay2win the developers have made sure that a free player who puts in the work is not only on par with but will have gear that statistically excels payed gear. Modifiable variants of all gear can be found in game.

XP boosts are sold at a rate of 20 gold [.20 USD] per 24 hours for %50 extra XP, which can be combined with a premium membership for double XP.  This has no game balance breaking effects since the gear you unlock by leveling will place you in higher rank matches.

Over all its a great FPS that will surely become a shining post-apocalyptic star in what has become a watered down genre.  As stated above this review is of version 0.29 of the game, but if the developers keep going the way they are this game will be fantastic by completion.  It already contains more depth and mechanics than your average AAA shooter.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Let me state a few things before you read this, I am an Oceanic play (New Zealand) and this is from MY point of view.

Ok listen up all you S.T.A.L.K.E.R fans, Curious Gamers and Masters of the Cheeki Breeki, here is what I think you need to know about the free-to-play Survarium, the green/post-apocalyptic fps. Let’s start off with some important things.

This game is NOT a P2W (Pay to Win). It’s a pay to grind less
Some players state this because of a few things, the frustration of seeing that Golden gun (upgraded weapon) that kills them fast that only has slightly better stats (and if you played games such as COD or any other first person shooter where you can die faster than you could say “omfg you piece of-“ You can’t say the rest cause you are dead! ), you know that that 10% damage isn’t going to help so  when you get shot in the ♥♥♥♥ing head with a bolt action sniper, it was not that 10% damage increase, it was you running through the field like a COD player. This game is more of a pay to do less grinding (much like Warframe) because you can still get the same stats (e.g. that 10% damage you people cry about when getting shot up) just like a person who pays Real Life money. However, with Real life money, the weapons/armour you get have a money/xp bonus which is still by the way pay to do less grinding. Either way, a pay to win is a game that you can ONLY PROGRESS FURTHER by PAYING MONEY! So to all those dumbasses out there calling this game a P2W, know what P2W is before you start yapping them ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥t spammers!

It’s a BETA!
S.T.A.L.K.E.R fans, Curious Gamers and Masters of the Cheeki Breeki, don’t expect too much as this game is still in beta. For those who wanted to fight mutants, do missions in an open world but get angry because that has not came out in a long time realise this, it is SMART to get the pvp balanced out and sorted before going for something so big. Can you imagine how annoying and buggy it can be if they introduced all these functions so soon? Yeah… Besides if you did not realise, most games take quite a while to make, so the longer they take, the better it can be . It’s also got very good graphics and sound (especially the sound!). It also has some very awesome features coming up which I cannot wait to see like open world and such (so when this game is finally out, it won’t be just another COD clone)

Difficulty
It is easy to die in this game (just like most fps games). It can be fun, mainly if you fight vs players that are as strong and skilled as you. Also you cannot run around like in COD guns blazing, you do that here in Survarium you get Cheeki Breeki (get shot the ♥♥♥♥ out of you!). So Stealth is a big mechanic in this game. However it can get very unfair! Now imagine this, the matchmaking system is ♥♥♥♥ as you get matched up agents players who have very powerful equipment (not upgraded, but weapons of extreme power!). For example, you (the guy with a rusty pistol and a little bolt action sniper with no scope) get put up vs people with accurate, automatic big guns (LMG) and amazing armour and gear and skill (cause they had to play a long time to get that kind of ♥♥♥♥) and you WILL die S.T.A.L.K.E.R fans, Curious Gamers and Masters of the Cheeki Breeki. But why is the match making so ♥♥♥♥? Because there is not enough players. Gamers get shooed away but the bad reviews and ones that stay fight vs other newbies which can be fun but them as you progress you’ll find yourself fighting stronger people, if not ones that are overpowered! So please! Join Survarium and do you part in improving the match making!

Connection Speed
Now here is something you guys need to know. If Matchmaking is too slow, you can select more server regions to fasten the matchmaking, however expect your game to lag badly. I am an Oceanic Player, so I have never experienced good ping, NEVER! There are 3 servers to choose from EU, US and RU. The lowest ping I could experience is 350-400 on the US servers. So if you are not from those regions or close to them, expect heavy lag and high ping!

To Conclude, Survarium is a game with big potential and I recommend it. Because hey, it’s a free-to-play so no harm right?

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAlright. Now that i've played this game for about 15 hours. I feel like i can write a review. I have beeen looking and following the development of this game ever since it was announced in 2013 promising an open world stalker/ish game. It caught my attention since i'm a long time S.T.A.L.K.E.R fan. Then they decided to introduce a PVP mode instead of the open-world version which disappointed me a little bit, the game still doesn't have the open world game mode but the developers have promised it to come in the future. Now to talk about the PVP mode. Let's start with the Pros: Very addicting, not P2W, fun to play with friends since you can go all tactical in the research mode, a wide variety of weapons and it even has factions, immersive maps it really gives you that post apocalyptic feeling, skills matter, and a good skills/level up system. Cons: Shotguns are way too overpowered, just 7 maps, anomalies are just annoying and doesn't really contribute much to the game. Although the game is really fun and i definetely recommend people that liked the S.T.A.L.K.E.R and the metro series to try this game out. The open world game mode still isn't out but i'm waiting patiently and i have faith in the developers. 7,7/10

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I don't really review things, but this game leaves me so conflicted that I felt like I should leave my 2 cents.

This game is F2P, so give it a shot. See if it's your thing. You can have fun with it.

That said this game is absolutely Pay to Win. All the fun I had early on has been completley offset by the fact that the team with the most money invested will win. Players who buy heavy armor and a gun become raid bosses. They can simply walk through the center of the map killing until they get to the enemy spawn, then spawn camp until they are finally brought down. Rinse-repeat-win.

All the interesting mechanics, detailed post apocolyptic settings, and Fallout-y vibe are 100% offset by the fact that the game is unbalanced, and is probably built that way on purpose to get people to buy stuff.

This game could get better. I think with a little more balance and refinement it could really become a true FPS Fallout/or a CoD version of Stalker...but it probably won't. They will probably stick with their P2W model and fade away like so many others.

reviewText:
First of all disregard time played, I have been playing this game from the moment it entered the Closed Beta.

Game Modes

Well where to begin. At this point in time Survarium has several PvP modes available for you to play.
First up is Scavenge, in this mode 2 teams of 8 players start must sniff around the map for batteries,
these spawn in random but fairly predictable locations around the map, some will be out in plain sight,
and some close to or within the anomaly( I will get to this later) on the map. These must be picked up
and delivered to a charging station located close to your spawn and indicated on the map, while carrying
you are 100% vulnerable, unable to spring or perform any functions aside from moving, jumping and being
able to drop the battery. There are a total of 10 of them all around the map and you need to have more
on your team's side to win. Mind you while this sounds simple it is much more complicated than that,
as batteries can be STOLEN by the enemy and vice versa, a common and rather sour strategy is to collect
a safe" amount of batteries
date: usually 6 or +2 of whatever the enemy has
recommended: and when the countdown reaches\nlow like 10 - 20 seconds depending on the map
hoursPlayed: people just rush the enemy charger and unplug all batteries.\nNext mode is Charging Stations
voteText: in this mode instead of locating the batteries several charging stations are\nplaced within the environment
helpfulPercent: these randomly but once again fairly predictably spawn a single battery which\nmust be taken to your charging station
votesHelpful: once the first battery is spawned they begin spawning subsequently roughly\nonce every 30 seconds.\nThird and the most recently added mode is Research
votesTotal: I personally do not like this mode and avoid it
votesFunny: so go find\ninfo on it somewhere else.\nLast but not least is your traditional Team Deathmatch
commentsCount: no batteries
column16: just pure old fashioned bloodshed with 150\nspawn tickets for each team and 15 minutes of time
column17:
whichever runs out first.

Features

Survarium can be played in several different ways
column18: much like the majority of modern day shooters you have access\nto a rather impressive arsenal of weapons and gear
column19: and decent customization to both. At this stage the guns cannot\nbe messed with
column20: ie silencers scopes etc
column21: but that will be added at some point in time. The outfitting customization\nhowever is most impressive
column22: different types of clothing Feet/Legs/Chest/Hands/Face/Head/Back
column23: of these Chest and Head\ncan have changeable cloth types and camo types as well up to 2 player placed decals. You can basically blend into almost\nanything in the game if you know how to do it right
column24: and if not moving you can be a pain in the ♥♥♥ to see
column25: and locate.\nWhile most people think "Ohhh f**king campers everywhere" allow me to assure you that it is not the case as the guns being\nso goddam lethal if you know where to shoot a sniper is rarely stationary
column26: moving place to place as the sound alone will\nattract every enemy within half the map's radius. That pretty much covers the basic stuff. And then there are things like\nTraps
column27: Explosives
column28: Anomalies and Artifacts
column29: oh and soon Mutants. At this point in time the only trap is the Bear Trap\nwhich
column31: will 9/10 times break your legs and cripple you

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nA decent free-to-play shooter with S.T.A.L.K.E.R. overtones. The game has potential to be something special, but the development is slow and the PVE freeplay" that drew me to the cocept does not seem to be coming any time soon (no news on that at all recently). That said
date: the team at Vostok is active and communicates with the community several times a month. Since its free
recommended:
there is no reason not to try this game -- I have had fun with it so far. Most of my "cons" are things Vostok will likely fix at some point.

-- 6.5/10 --

Pros:
-Decent gunplay
-Pay-to-win factor is low
-Cool artifact system
-Good S.T.A.L.K.E.R. vibe
-Interesting faction progression with tons of unlocks
-Nice visuals
-Match-end mystery drop is always fun
-Not very many bugs for an early access game

Cons:
-PVE "freeplay" mode still pending (slow development on that end)
-Character animations/movement as seen from 3rd person are pretty rough
-Weapon balance pass needed (automatics are far and away superior to anything else)
-PvP gameplay has little varriety between the three game modes so progression can become tedious
-Its not S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 2 -- I know the devs are sick and tired of hearing this
hoursPlayed: but it's what I really want."
