reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nThe game is fun, the controls are very smooth, and even the starting equipment feels very powerful. There's a wide range of different weapons and equipment, and the vast majority of it can be purchased with the in-game currency. This is a great example of a game where the Free To Play model doesn't get in the way of the game.
voteText: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
Early Access Review

So far, Survarium is a pretty unique game, setting and gameplay-wise. The atmosphere is spot on, the ambient sounds, the looks, the aesthetics are just perfect. It really helps you immerse yourself in the game.

The gameplay is very different from what I'm used to. It's less of a Call of Duty-style twitch shooting, and more of a game where you actually feel like you're fighting for survival. Team coordination is key, and you'll experience some pretty Hollywood-like moments here and there when someone rescues you from enemy gunfire or the other way around.

So far the game shows lots of potential, but as of yet it is severely lacking in terms of content. I feel like there should be more modes which are much more survival oriented, more character progression and more story content. For example, you're asked to choose a faction to side with, but the thing is that you're never given a description of these factions, what their motives are, what they do, why would I want to join them? This is something which needs to be taken care of IMMEDIEATELY.

Another thing is the optimisation. It outright sucks balls. I'm getting an absolutely horrible framerate, and I wouldn't really say that the graphics justify that, considering that it looks like a PS3 launch title. And the motion blur is just awful - it's like you're drugged at all times, turn it off completely.

So far, Survarium is not the greatest game ever, definitely. But, you can give it the benefit of it being in Early access and turn a blind eye for some of the missing functions. Plus, it's free, so you really lose nothing besides HDD space.

I'm excited to see what becomes of this game in the future.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

In my 2 hours of playing the game I have learned something... Dont trust the anomalys, for the love of god.
In all seriousness the game has its fair share of bugs but none are that overwhelming in the sense that they dont break the game.
Thats right... there are NO game breaking bugs.
Survarium is also tailored to those who have played the STALKER games and like that whole Anomalys will screw you up" stuff. Survarium is a team based shooter set in a apocalyptic world filled with other people who want you dead. The guns crack out and the ambinat sound casued by them really makes the maps feel like it is two teams vying for control. The gamemodes are as follows
date: TDM team death match which is kill the other team over and over to win. Research
recommended: control points that require capturing and holding to gain points to win. And a capture the flag mode which very few people wish to play for some reason. Any ways the game pushes you in with either a Mosin nagant
hoursPlayed: a PPsh 41
voteText:
or a winchester lever action and a few med packs to stop bleeding.
Pros:
Fun leveling
The guns are punchy and sound great
Unique maps that change with the addition of deadly anomalys
Gear customization and asthetics are pleasent and satisfying
Matchmaking is not an *****
No (Almost) hackers if that none are really there to ruin it
F2P with a purpose and very little Pay 2 win stuff. (All of the Pay 2 Win stuff is worse than the highlevel credit bough stuff anyways
Cons:
Internet connection is the only real problem
Some hit detection issues but nothing that made me throw the game away.

The game also has a faction system where you unlock different gear and weapons based on the faction you pick
helpfulPercent: I find them all to be pretty rewarding in their own way.\nOverall this game is heading in the right direction and should be something you want to check out. Its free so there is nothing to lose in downloading it.\nGive it a try and if you dont like it just keep playing anyways becasue the longer you play the more rewards you get."

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nBest free to play game I have played to date ! Not really sure where the mixed reviews have come from at all. Give this a try and i guarantee you'll be addicted after an hour or so. The combat is fantastic and the maps are really well designed. The game does need a few tweaks with damage balancing but nothing major. There is a survival mode incoming that sounds really exciting, I just hope they will add in attachments for weapons at some point too. If you dont mind a levelling up system then you honestly will never need to spend a penny on this game either as you get ingame currency to pay for armour and weapons that upgrade with each higher rank you become. Great things expected from this game, don't make the mistake of writing it off.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nYes I know that I don't have many hours But i can already tell that this game is wonderful and has great potential I saw the reviews thinking I would hate the game but to my surprise I enjoyed it greatly the weapons are balanced (atleast in my experience) you start with two weapons both USSR WW2 era weapons the PPSH or the Mosin Nagant Yes you may think you have a distinct advantage with the PPSH being fully automatic but you will still be killed many times if you keep that mindset you have to think that everyone with a rifle has the best aim in the world because a Mosin Nagant is a one hit kill most of the time if you use the PPSH you have to either get the first shot or hope they miss and don't get a lucky headshot with their pistol overall I highly recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a great free FPS

Early Access Review

At first I liked this game very much since I am a fan of Stalker series. When you start playing at first you enjoy, than you notice that it has some bugs (like starting a match in 3rd person mode in which you cant control you character wtf?!), than you notice low fps despite your rig, than a mouse lag that makes it hard to aim. Time passes you reach level 16 and guess what? you meet people with level 13 who have bought a weapon with real money like AKM gold and ... You die in a single hit despite your armor or other protection!

SUMMARY: PAY TO WIN SUX!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

The game is very fun but needs a lot of work on polishing. There's missing game modes and that is reflected in the early access tag on the store page.

Now that's out of the way I'd like to say that I'm really enjoying the game. As an avid STALKER fan I was happy to see the universe taken in a new direction. It might not be a direct link to the series but it definitely has that feel to it. The only mode available now is the PVP mode which is enjoyable but does come with it's downsides, for example hackers. The game has a pay model similar to War Thunder, which most people may see as pay to win but does also come with a nerf of sorts in which all weapons that aren't the default starting weapons require you to buy ammo for them and repair them when they need it.

Overall I like the game a lot but it does need a lot of polishing before it could be considered feature complete.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nQuite a funny game to play since it finally removed the performance issue it had with 9xx Nvidia cards. Game modes are quite simple and nothing really new, but in my opinion the map design is really nice and the areas are huge! it sometimes is annoing if things change and for example your guns get nerfed from one to another day or your ranks you already had inside a certain faction are now resetted/ignored and your cant buy your unlocked items anymore, but thats probably something you cant avoid during beta state. The pay2win factor is not as bad as in other games and i hope those things get removed once the game gets released fully.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I really like this game.
I've only started playing this game a week ago, so I have no idea what the developer has or has not promised and don't much care. The game is running really well on my PC, and I've only had one crash on 30+ matches. And all I had to do was close the game down and start it up again, and I was in the match again.
The game is a FPS mix of stalker and call of duty. The maps are stalker'ish large and beautiful with lots of places to ambush the opponents. And it's flaws are COD'ish as it's possible to camp spawn and matches can be very uneven.
I've had a ton off fun playing this game so far, but I'm also good at FPS's. So that the opponent has better weapons and equipment than me on the ranked matches is just a challenge. And nobody is forcing you to do the ranked matches before you have lvl'ed you faction up and gained access to the better weapons.

Early Access Review

Actually a very fun FTP, If I was playing this game to be great at it and play competitively I would probably have more complaints. Going into it as a very fun FPS that I can listen to music and play with good movement, weapons, and amazing maps/atmosphere.

My first hour in-game showed me that either many issues" with this game are exaggerated or fixed(OR SIMPLY DONT APPLY TO MY 3 YEAR OLD PC)
date: either way I had no Hitbox/reg problems. Even with a small playerbase it never took me more that 5 minutes to find a match and while I waited I browsed through the extensive skill/weapon/armor customization and it is as impressive as they show it to be. I can only give my experience playing with the sniper rifle and pistol but even only regularly using the sniper rifle I can say weapons that should feel powerful DO(Sniper)

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I like the gunplay and atmosphere. The weapon and skill  progression is fine. The thing that makes this unplayable is the matchmaking. You will be matched depending what your highest equipped gear is. No matter what bonis you farmed for your weapons and armor or what  bonis you get from your player level. This means that you face people with maxed out gear while you try to earn your first armor part that fits your gun level. The Bonis those equipments have might be small but in addition to the Character skills and the amount of parts  you have ... it  adds up fast. So not only do you try to fight people that play the game for years and want to farm easy money on newbies but they are also WAY better equipped. It gets worse ! Cause of the small playerbase you get at least 2 lvl higher geared Opponents you can play target for.
Good News is you dont have to play as often cause the waiting time between matches is very long.
If they implement a better system it could be a good game until then look somewhere else.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

***[Review as of 0.29]***

Fantastic FPS with great devs.

many people are turned off by the price of the DLC packs however, This game is NOT pay2win the developers have made sure that a free player who puts in the work is not only on par with but will have gear that statistically excels payed gear. Modifiable variants of all gear can be found in game.

XP boosts are sold at a rate of 20 gold [.20 USD] per 24 hours for %50 extra XP, which can be combined with a premium membership for double XP.  This has no game balance breaking effects since the gear you unlock by leveling will place you in higher rank matches.

Over all its a great FPS that will surely become a shining post-apocalyptic star in what has become a watered down genre.  As stated above this review is of version 0.29 of the game, but if the developers keep going the way they are this game will be fantastic by completion.  It already contains more depth and mechanics than your average AAA shooter.

reviewText: Early Access Review\n\nAlright. Now that i've played this game for about 15 hours. I feel like i can write a review. I have beeen looking and following the development of this game ever since it was announced in 2013 promising an open world stalker/ish game. It caught my attention since i'm a long time S.T.A.L.K.E.R fan. Then they decided to introduce a PVP mode instead of the open-world version which disappointed me a little bit, the game still doesn't have the open world game mode but the developers have promised it to come in the future. Now to talk about the PVP mode. Let's start with the Pros: Very addicting, not P2W, fun to play with friends since you can go all tactical in the research mode, a wide variety of weapons and it even has factions, immersive maps it really gives you that post apocalyptic feeling, skills matter, and a good skills/level up system. Cons: Shotguns are way too overpowered, just 7 maps, anomalies are just annoying and doesn't really contribute much to the game. Although the game is really fun and i definetely recommend people that liked the S.T.A.L.K.E.R and the metro series to try this game out. The open world game mode still isn't out but i'm waiting patiently and i have faith in the developers. 7,7/10

Early Access Review

Sure, there are some bugs, sure at the higher equipment levels (matchmaking is based on equipment, not character level) cheaters are more rampant, and sure, some of the balance is whack.

Over all though? I'm having a lot of fun with the game. I'm hoping that VG gets the freeplay/PvE mode up and running sooner rather than later, but over all I really enjoy it.
